loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as energetic.

Harriet operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

Harriet will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Ngumbao

texts.en:
Ngumbao is a married man who has two children. He describes himself as honest. Ngumbao operates a retail business where he sells tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient capital.

Ngumbao will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Zosima earns additional income from selling dried fish.

Zosima is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle and spare parts for her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Zosima has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle and spare parts for her business

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 37 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Ivy is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ivy requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 51-year-old married woman from the Khelvachauri district. Her family consists of three children and two daughters-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow mandarin and nut trees.

Lia wants to start a poultry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 6,000 GEL to purchase chicks. Lia will resell raised hens and eggs in future and will increase her family income.

loans.use: to start a poultry business

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwani Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Yakubu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield.

Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Yakubu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare - double the national average in Nigeria - and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 48 bags of maize this year, Yakubu can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en:
Usaini is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwani Village. Usaini joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Usaini suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees.

Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Usaini has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, and to earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 45 bags of maize this year, Usaini can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en:
Fortunee is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her eight siblings on a farm in a rural area of Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because of its academic rigor and reputation for job placement. Fortunee plans to support her family through her career in the private sector as she knows her parents will eventually have to retire from work in agriculture due to the intensive physical demands o the work.  

Fortunee plans to major in Business and Communications, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she wants to either pursue an MBA, or work at a startup. At Kepler, she hopes to refine her skills in technology, while approaching everything she does with courage and perseverence.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia está estudiando Contabilidad, para poder ser una buena profesional para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Ella viene de una familia muy unida que lucha por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus útiles de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Delia is studying Accounting. She wants to be a good professional and to be able to help her loved ones.

She comes from a very tight knit family who fights hard in order to grow and get ahead.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase university supplies so she can continue in her studies.

loans.use: university supplies.

loans.name: Nanci

texts.es:
Nanci está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de licenciatura en  enfermería, su meta es terminar  su carrera y trabajar para ayudar a  mejorar no solo su vida, sino también la de su familia.
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carreras y de esa forma poder seguir luchando sus metas.
texts.en:
Nanci is in her third year of studies for her nursing degree. Her goal is to finish her degree and to work not only to improve her own life, but that of her family.

She is a persona with a will to get ahead. She is asking for this loan in order to pay for university fees associated with her degree so she can continue working towards her goals.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old. She is a married woman with four children ages seven to twelve. She works hard for her family. Since her husband is a fisherman, she is engaged in fishing and selling fresh fish. Also, they farm rice for a living.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pay for the hired help's labor, and buy grocery items like corn starch, cooking oil, sugar, and dried fish. They would like to expand their fishing business in order to give their children a better future through education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for the hired help's labor, and buy grocery items like corn starch, cooking oil, sugar, and dried fish.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is a married man who has four children. He describes himself as faithful. Japhet operates a retail business where he sells bread and he has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as the lack of a good means of transport for his bread.

Japhet will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bread. His business goal is to have a big shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open a wholesale shop and be a huge distributor of bread. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He repaid his previous loan successfully. Japhet will use his anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 32 years old. He is married with two children. His business is selling goats. He has been in this business for five years. He earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the loan to buy goats to sell.

He plans to use the profits to pay school fees for his children and to expand the business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be a big livestock trader.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Angelina was able to buy grocery items to add to her business. She’s thankful for people who help entrepreneurs who need financial support. She prays that God will continuously bless them, not just financially but in all aspects of life. Her sales are increasing daily since she added more products to the display in her variety store, which became more appealing to customers.

Despite the competition in her line of work, Angelina perseveres in reaching her goal. She aims to have a one-stop-shop where all of the items her customers need are available. She applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 to add additional products to her variety store. She will buy grocery items such as bottled drinks, canned goods, school supplies, and sacks of rice. She hopes that Kiva lenders will again consider her story.

Angelina spends time attending a CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually, hear testimonies from other CCT partners, reflect on God’s word, build social relationships, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her variety store

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with five children, four of whom attends school and the other one is still young for schooling . She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 45-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has six children. Her oldest school-aged child is 20 years old while her youngest child is 10 years old.

Her husband is a farmer, while she runs a sari-sari store business. She has been running this business for 20 years. Aside from her sari-sari store business, Myrna also raises pigs. 

She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, drinking liquor, chips, candies, biscuits, spices, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink. She will also use part of her requested loan to repair her piggery.

Myrna dreams of expanding her business in the future to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor, chips, candies, biscuits, spices, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink and to repair her piggery.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia es de la ciudad de San Pedro, su meta es poder ser una buena abogada y por medio de su profesión poder ser alguien en la vida.
Se está esforzando para poder ser una buena profesional útil, no solo a sí misma, sino también a los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de la matrícula de su carrera, y de esa forma continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nidia is from San Pedro and her goal is to be a lawyer. She wants to be successful in life.

She is working hard in order to be a useful in her career, not only for herself but also for others.

She is asking for this loan in order to pay university tuition so she can continue in her studies.

loans.use: pay university tuition.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
At 61, Desideria is a hard-working widow and a farmer. She farms rice and to earn an income.

Desideria has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for hired labor to help prepare the land. With all this arranged, she can speed up her farming activity with the help of other people.

Desideria hopes to have an abundant harvest in four months time and a better return on her investment. She hopes to increase her income so she can support herself.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for hired labor to help prepare the land

loans.name: Bennet

texts.en:
Bennet is a married man who has six children. He describes himself as honest. Bennet operates a poultry farm where he keeps ducks and chicken. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient capital.

Bennet will use this KES 70,000 loan to buy more poultry and construct two more poultry structures. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. He repaid his previous loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy more poultry and construct two more poultry structures.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 35 years old, married, and supports two children. He is a small-scale farmer.

Kennedy has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops for a better harvest. He plans to use his anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow for milk production, as well as to educate his children. Kennedy hopes to improve his family's living standards and health care .

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops for a better harvest.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
15 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, son mujeres unidas que se sacrifican por el bien de sus seres queridos y de las personas a quienes ellas quieren. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder crecer y mejorar.
Cada una está luchando para ser alguien en la vida, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Silvina quien es la Presidenta del grupo, ella tiene alquileres de sillas y mesas y también tiene la idea de ir mejorando para poder tener mayores servicios para ofrecer a sus clientes, y por medio de sus ingresos poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertir su dinero para poder comprar telas, cintas, presilladoras y otros productos para implementar el servicio de decoraciones a su servicio de alquileres.
texts.en:
Fifteen women make up the group La Esperanza ( in English, Hope). The women are very close and they sacrifice for the good of their loved ones. They are in a program that focuses on the elimination of poverty and working to grow and improve.

Every one of them fights hard in order to become someone successful. But among them, Mrs. Silvina really stands out. She is the President of the group and she has workshops that make tables and chairs. She also had the idea to look for ways to improve her business in order to offer a better service to her customers and to earn more money to help her family.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest the money in purchasing fabric, ribbons, sewing machines and other products they use in order to create their final product.

loans.use: purchase fabric, ribbons, sewing machines and other products in order to supply their decorating business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa está trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas son mujeres luchadoras que quieren salir adelante,  y tienen la esperanza de poder hacerlo por medio de la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Deisi quien se dedica a la venta de Hamburguesas, comenta que creció bastante y que hoy ya tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las delicias que vende. Se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en poder comprar hamburguesas en cantidad, panificado, hortalizas y otros. Agradece por esta oportunidad de crecer que recibe.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Guapa is in a program that focuses on poverty elimination. They are hard working women who want to get ahead and they have the hope to be able to do so with the help of fundación paraguaya.

One of the members is Señora Deisi who runs a business selling hamburgers. She says that her business has really grown and today she has a good clientele who are always buying her food. She defines herself as a hard working person.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest in her business and buy hamburgers, bread, vegetables and more. She is thankful for this opportunity.

loans.use: purchase hamburgers, bread, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Flor De Yukyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité  Flor de Yukyry está en el ciclo 4to ciclo del programa de comités de la fundación paraguaya, están iniciando con muchas expectativas de poder mejorar y ayudar a sus seres queridos. Son mujeres luchadoras que quieren salir adelante para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Helem, una de las integrantes de este grupo, tiene una modesta peluquería, y por medio de su trabajo se gana la vida para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, se ha hecho ya de muchos clientes gracias al buen servicio que siempre brinda a sus clientes, y todos están muy a gusto con ella.
Helem pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y otros, y así seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
The Comité  Flor de Yukyry is in the 4th cycle of the Fundación Paraguaya committee program. They are starting out with high hopes to be able to improve and help their loved ones. They are tenacious women who want to get ahead so that they can improve their living conditions. 

Helem, one of the group members, has a modest hair salon, which allows her to earn a living and help her loved ones. She now has many clients thanks to the good service she always offers them, and they all like her very much. 

Helem is requesting this loan in order to buy supplies for her hair salon, such as hair color, conditioners, shampoos, rinses, so that she can continue to offer good service to her clients. She is grateful for this opportunity to improve her small business.

loans.use: to buy hair color, conditioners, shampoos, rinses, and so on

loans.name: Lysette

texts.en:
Lysette is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her impressive academic record and test scores, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose to attend Kepler because it offers the technology training and networking opportunities that she will need in her career.

Lysette plans to study Health Care Management and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduation, she would like to contribute to humanitarian causes, such as working in a health NGO. Lysette also wants to earn enough to help support her family.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Rachel has been in this business for six years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Louis Robert

texts.en:
Louis is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up in a small town near Congo with his mother and four siblings. Due to his impressive academic record and test scores, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. He chose Kepler because he wants to learn the skills necessary to have a fulfilling career.

Louis plans to study Health Care Management and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduation, he would like to work as a social service provider for the government or an NGO. Louis also wants to earn enough to support his younger brothers and sisters through school.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 38 years old and she is the mother of two children. She has been in business for four years, dealing in secondhand clothing.

This marks her first time getting a loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase bales of secondhand clothes. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and she hopes to do better in future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a food production/vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

Grace has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a married man with two children. He operates a retail business where he sells cassava. He has been involved in this business for 3 years.

His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is insufficient capital. He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more cassava.

loans.use: to buy more cassava

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cattle. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more cows. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Julieth

texts.en:
Julieth is 60 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Julieth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, candies, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Julieth has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, candies, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

Julieth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, candies, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, 35 years old, is married and supports one child. He is a hardworking small scale sugarcane farmer.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray his crops for quality production.

He plans to use the gained profits to lease more land to expand his farming activity as well as repay his loan. He hopes to build a modern homestead from the money raised after selling his sugarcane.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray his crops for quality production.

loans.name: Robson

texts.en: Robson is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be a risk taker. He operates a retail business where he sells auto spare parts. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spare parts and start his M-pesa business. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts and start his M-pesa business.

loans.name: Dionesiana

texts.en:
Dionesiana works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Dionesiana requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, seasonings, meat, noodles, etc. for her food production business.

Dionesiana has been in this business for 15 years now.

Dionesiana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, seasonings, meat, noodles, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married  woman and staying together with her husband and  five children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rabo

texts.en: Rabo is a Babban Gona farmer from Gwani Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Rabo no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably. This season Rabo has ambitious plans to harvest 10 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rabo now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is engaged in food vending business. She is 32 years old and a resident in Albuera, Leyte. She is married with three children ages eleven, three and one year old. Her husband works hard as a school bus driver. She is asking a loan of PHP8000 to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and banana fruit. Elena has been engaged in this business for five years. She hopes to expand this business to upturn their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil and banana fruit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics such as lipstick, nail polish, face powder, skin whitener, body lotion etc to be sold.

loans.name: Shamba

texts.en: Shamba is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in a prime place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a hotel that can accommodate more people within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah, 51 years old, is married and supports one child. He is a hardworking small scale sugarcane farmer.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray his crops for quality production.

He plans to use the gained profits to lease more land to expand his farming activity as well as repay his loan. He hopes to have a financially stable old life.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray his crops for quality production.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy charcoal to start selling. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to start selling.

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en:
Jerelyn is 36 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Jerelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, can goods, etc.

Jerelyn has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Jerelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, can goods, etc

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 60000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Haide has been in this business for 6 years. Haide earns more income from general store and school supplies retailing.

Haide has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
At her age of 19, Han is married and has a dependent child who is under age of school. She resides in Kampong Cham province where the cassava has been growing as the main source of family’s income for a year. Her husband is working as motorcycle repairman to earn supplemental income.

Cassava growing unhealthily and producing low yields are the challenge to the business. Forming a group of two members to apply for a new loan, Han is the second-cycle borrower to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has improved both of her living condition and cassava farming business as she wisely used it. Han will use her loan to buy weedicide and to pay for the paid workers to help her crop grow well. She hopes she can generate more income so as to start a new business (black pepper growing).

loans.use: to buy weedicide and to pay for the paid workers to help her crop grow well.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a Babban Gona farmer from Gwani Village. she joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Hannatu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for her children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see increase her increase her income considerably. This season Hannatu has ambitious plans to harvest 12 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu now has the opportunity to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields.

loans.name: Yaha

texts.en: Yaha is a Babban Gona farmer from Gwani Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realize better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Yaha no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to provide healthcare for her family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see her increase her income considerably. This season Yaha has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yaha now has the opportunity to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 28 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Ludivina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ludivina has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en: Angelito is 34 years old. He is married with three teenage children ages 14, 15 and 16. Angelito is engaged in “habal-habal” driving. This local business is called “habal-habal” service which means that a motorcycle has extended seat and can accommodate up to two or more passengers. Aside from driving, he is also engaged in selling food (barbecue). This happens during the evenings when people prefer having barbecue for dinner. He is asking a loan to buy gasoline (for his motorcycle) and chicken meat for his barbecue business. This will allow him to earn more income. In the future, he hopes to have other sources of income to uplift his family’s living condition.  He lives in Baybay, Leyte.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and chicken meat

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, bread, sweets, cooking oil, detergents and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, rice, detergents, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, rice, detergents,cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
She is Vilma, 61 years old and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She’s a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). Vilma is involved in selling feeds and supplies for poultry and pigs for 7 years now. She buys high volume (sacks) of these supplies then she retails it per kilo to poultry and pig raisers. Pigs and poultry are popular form of livestock since they are raised as human food, ingredients for processed foods, and pig skin is also a good source of leather clothing. She’s earning approximately P50,400 each month. However, she cannot put all of the profits in the business since she also has to sustain her family's daily needs and support her children's education.

However, feeds, vitamins and other supplies are getting expensive as time passes by. That’s why Vilma applied for a P20,000 as an added capital to augment her business. With this, she’ll be able to buy more feeds, vitamins and other supplies that she can sell. She wants to thank lenders for helping new entrepreneurs in terms of monetary support. She believes that God will sustain more blessings to those who are compassionate in helping others.

Vilma is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from member’s life changing testimony. She can also share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy more feeds, vitamins and other supplies that she can sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma works hard to support her family. Elma is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Elma has been in this business for 28 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Aniway

texts.en:
Aniway is 38 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Aniway has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a smallholder farmer based in the Chuka area of Kenya and is married. For 10 years, Priscilla has been doing mixed farming. She has dairy cattle, poultry, tomatoes, bananas, vegetables and trees on her 1 acre farmland.

Priscilla is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for her cows. She will use the money to buy construction materials and pay for the relevant transportation and labor costs.

The cowshed, once constructed, will provide an ample environment for her cows to feed and rest. This loan investment will help Priscilla to cut animal healthcare expenses and make more income from enhanced productivity of the animals.

loans.use: To construct a cow shed

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is happily married and is blessed with adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Kapsowar area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman seeking to access funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because of its emphasis on practical skills and on-the-job learning.

An outstanding student, Redempta plans to major in Communications with a concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She also hopes to improve her public speaking skills. After graduating, her dream is to start her own business.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Aurora Luisa

texts.es:
AURORA TIENE 55 AÑOS, CONVIVIENTE, SIN CARGA FAMILIAR. TIENE 02 HIJOS DISIPADOS QUIENES TRABAJAN. VIVE EN CASA PROPIA.EN EL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU. ES UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA, GANADERIA Y CRINZA Y COMERCIO DE AVES DE CORRAL.

AURORA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BODEGA Y A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES (PATOS, CERDOS)CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES, CON PRESTAMO REALIZARÁ COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS DE ROPA Y CALZADO Y OTROS PARA SURTIR NEGOCIO ASÍ, OFRECERÁ UNA MEJOR ATENCIÓN A SUS CLIENTES CON MAYOR STOCK DE MERCADERIA . A SU VEZ OTORGARÁ UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Aurora is 55 years old and is in a realtionship with no dependent family. She has two children who have moved away and work. She lives in her own house in the district of Cayalti, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru. It is a community that works in commerce, agriculture and raising livestock and poultry.

Aurora works selling products in her store and raising and selling animals (ducks and pigs) and she has good work and personal references. She will use the loan to buy clothing and footwear products to stock her business. She can then offer her clients better service with a greater stock of merchandise. And at the same time provide her family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear products to stock her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras está en su ciclo número  1 del programa de comité de mujeres, se formó en la ciudad de Caacupé con la unión de 15 mujeres muy sacrificadas que quieren salir adelante.
 La señora Patricia, una de las integrantes, ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con una Peluquería que posee en su casa. Comenta que tiene ya muy buena clientela y que siempre se acercan hasta ella para poder acceder al buen servicio que siempre da. Ha ido creciendo poco a poco por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio.
El  fin del préstamo que pide es para mejorar su local, también para la compra de utensilios para mayor comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Luchadoras is in its first cycle of the Women's Communal Bank Program. It was formed in the city of Caacupé, with the union of fifteen dedicated women who want to get ahead.

Señora Patricia, one of the members, helps to support her family with a beauty salon that she has in her house. She comments that she already has very good customers, and that they always come to her in order to get the good service that she always gives. Little by little, it has been growing by means of her effort and dedication.

the purpose of the loan that she is requesting is to improve her shop, and for the purchase of equipment to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.use: to improve the beauty shop and purchase equipment.

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
For almost 15 years, Daria earns a living by engaging in dress  making services. She is 58-year old woman with five grown children. She earns six thousand pesos a month out of dressmaking.  She has avail the loan to finance her main source of income.

Daria is asking for a loan to buy supplies like cloth, needle, thread, and other accessories. Thus, she could continue receive the orders of her customers.  With these, her income will improve and she could start to expand her business. With these, she could start to set aside some money for emergency use.

In the future, she  dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy supplies like cloth, needle, thread, and other accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray her crops for more harvest.

loans.name: Maria Estrella

texts.en: Maria Estrella is engaged in hog raising business for two years. She is a resident in Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has eight adult children. One of these eight children is still attending school, aged 20 years old. Maria Estrella is asking a loan of PHP5000 to buy feed. In the future, she wishes to increase the number of her pigs. With that, she wishes to have a piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Preciousa

texts.en:
Preciousa is 52 years old and married with two children. With two children still in school, Preciousa works very hard to provide for them.

Preciousa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Preciousa has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, canned goods, vinegar, soft drinks, coffee, etc.

In the future, Preciousa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Boaz Group

texts.fr: Franc est une femme d’affaires,  membre du groupe de crédits «Boaz», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 48 ans mère de 8 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et 2 ont déjà terminé leurs études. Elle est vendeuse des produits pharmaceutiques dans le centre commercial depuis 25 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle va acheter des antibiotiques, pommades de massage, des antipaludéens, des anti- inflammatoires, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Franc is an entrepreneur, a member of the Boaz borrowers' group, and a client of IMF Hekima. She is a widow, 48 years old, and the mother of eight children, six of whom attend school and two already finishd3 their studies. Franc has been selling pharmaceutical products at the commercial center of her town for 25 years. She launched her business with the funds obtained from her husband while he was still alive. 

Franc will buy antibiotics, massage oils, anti-malarial medications, anti-inflammatory medications etc. She would like to grow her capital, build a house a provide for her children's education. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, massage oils, anti-malarial medications and anti-inflammatory  etc

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a 45-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has two dependents. The oldest child is 17, while the youngest is eight.

She engages in fishing together with her husband. Aside from fishing, Cristita is in the business of buying and selling dried fish. She buys and sells fish in her neighborhood. She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy a new fishing boat, fresh fish and styrofoam.

In the future, Cristita would like to increase her business profitability to support her family and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat, fresh fish and styrofoam.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Grace is 37 years old and her three children are in school.

Grace has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

Grace has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 48 years old and married. She has three children who are in school.

Luciana is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Luciana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Luciana has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luciana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries, juices, candy and other items.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen’s previous loan really helped her business, buying and selling plastic materials. She wants to thank lenders who read her story and provided monetary support. She was able to buy a large quantity of plastic varieties, resell them for recycling purposes, and gain profit from it. Although profit from this kind of business is not as great as other businesses, she persists in order to support her family.

Karen believes in the saying “may pera sa basura” or “there’s money in junk”. It is a job without any days off and where your hands get dirty just to make profit. Karen wants to expand her business. She also aims to invest in properties, save money for her future, continue to support her children’s education, and provide for the needs of her family. Aside from hard work and patience, capital is a crucial aspect for any business to succeed. That’s why she decided to apply for a 29,000 PHP loan this year that will be used to buy a large quantity of scrap material: not just plastic, but other varieties like metal, steel, carton and glass.

Karen is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she can gain spiritual strength from member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en: Ciriaca is 43 years old and from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has six children, ages 5 to 19. She operates a farming business where she grow rice. She also owns a tricycle for business. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, to pay for hired help, and to pay for a tricycle franchise.  Ciriaca aims to save her profits so that she can send her children to school. In the future, she hopes to see them all successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay for hired help, and to pay for a tricycle franchise.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rita is 34 years old and her three children are in school.

Rita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Rita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Rita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Luchadoras está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, las 15 integrantes del comité realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias. 
La señora Rossana, ayuda a mantener a su familia con una pequeña confitería que tiene, comenta que al principio fue muy complicado, pero hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella lo que vende. El  fin de este préstamo es la obtención de más capital  para  la compra de insumos para hacer sus productos en su confitería, como ser: harinas, mantecas, dulces, y otros, de manera a poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Luchadoras" communal bank is in their 2nd cycle with the Woman's Committee Program. The 15 members of the Committee make great efforts in getting ahead together with their families.

Rossana helps to support her family with the small confectionery shop she has. She commented that at the beginning it was very complicated but today she has a good clientele who always buy what she sells. The goal of this loan is to obtain more capital to buy the supplies to make the products in her shop such as flours, butter, sweets and others so that she can continue to work as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and improve

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, sweets and others.

loans.name: Tierra Prometida Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre Tierra Prometida está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante., se pusieron como meta poder mejorar sus vidas a través del trabajo en equipo y también a través de las capacitaciones de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes que se destaca por ser una persona trabajadora y por sobre todo muy entusiasta es la Sra. Sandra quien se dedica a la elaboración de Postres y decoraciones en general. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo que ella hace, da a su familia los medios para poder tener una vida digna y sin privaciones, y comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es honesto.
La Sra. Sandra solicita de este préstamo para la compra de Materia prima como ser: harinas, dulces de leches, guayaba, huevos entre otras cosas, para poder seguir con la elaboración de sus postres y otros.
texts.en:
The group named Tierra Prometida is in its fourth cycle with the women's committee program where all the members work and help each other succeed. They set a goal of improving their lives through teamwork and also through trainings from Fundacion Paraguaya.

One of the members of the group who is known for being a hardworking person and above all very enthusiastic, is Sandra who makes desserts and decorations in general. Through her work and effort she gives her family the means to have a dignified life without deprivation. She says that she is very proud of what she does because it is honest.

Sandra requests this loan to buy materials such as flour, milk candy, guava, eggs and other items to keep making her desserts and other items.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk candies, guava, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a married woman and a mother of a 18-year-old son from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for many years. This is something that she learned from her husband.

Esmeralda is asking for a loan to purchase paint and adhesive, and to pay for boat repair and house renovation. Through this additional capital, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Esmeralda hopes to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy paint and adhesive, and to pay for boat repair and house renovation.

loans.name: Wanjiru

texts.en:
Wanjiru is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be outgoing.

Wanjiru operates a retail business where she sells cereals. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her family's challenge to be a lack of clean water.

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. A previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married man. He has 2 children. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, bread, salt and other items. His primary customers are locals.

William describes his family's challenge to be a lack of clean water. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. A previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Mercideta

texts.en:
Mercideta is a 48-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with ten children. Five of these ten children are still attending school.

Her husband is a farmer, while she is engaged in buying and selling accessories like hair clips, head bands and bracelets. She also sells assorted slippers. They have been doing this to earn a living and to provide for the needs of their family.

To continue her business, Mercideta is asking for a loan to buy more accessories to sell. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to have enough money to send all her children to college to finish their degrees.

loans.use: to buy more accessories

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza 2 está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose cada una por poder mejorar sus vidas para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antonia quien en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró que ha ido mejorando y creciendo. Ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas que ella misma hace y que después se encarga de vender de manera ambulante, ella es muy luchadora y pone todo su interés para poder mejorar su vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer empandas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, panificados y otros,  y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group called Nueva Experanza 2 is in its fifth cycle with the women's committee program. The members are in the program to eliminate poverty and they are each making an effort to improve their lives so that they can help their families.

One of its members is Antonia who in a previous elimination of poverty survey showed that she has been improving and growing. She sells empanadas which she makes herself and then sells as a street vendor. She is hardworking and puts a lot of effort into improving her life.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in buying supplies to make empanadas such as vegetables, spices, meat, baked goods and other items. This will allow her to keep striving to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make empanadas such as vegetables, spices, meat, baked goods and other items.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 44 years old, and she is from the municipality of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three children.

Elvira’s husband is a carpenter, while she keeps herself busy in her rice fields. This has been her business for 15 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops healthy.

Elvira hopes that she can harvest enough to supply her family with food and additional income. In the future, she plans to reinvest in farming and make more expansions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Punda Milia Hope Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Lucy, a 40-year-old married mother of five. She is a member of Punda Milia Hope group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014, and has been trained in enterprise and financial management. 

Lucy operates a green grocer shop and will use her loan portion to buy more tomatoes, onions, kale, potatoes and capsicum to boost her enterprise. This will increase her profits, enabling her to pay for her children’s fees and clothing and buy better food.

Lucy is grateful to Kiva lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of groceries

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky, who is married, has been operating a broom-making business in the Philippines for five years now. She works hard to support her family. 

Jinky has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials such as bamboo, wire, rope, etc. for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like bamboo, wire, rope, etc. for her business

loans.name: Kuña Guaoa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Kuña Guapa, lo que quiere decir mujeres trabajadoras, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son 17 mujeres muy unidas y luchadoras que se esfuerzan por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Teodolina, quien se dedica a  la venta de perfumes y comenta que hace sus ventas sobre pedido y también tiene una cantidad variada que siempre ofrece a sus clientes. Ella es muy luchadora y pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes variados y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group is called Kuña Guapa, which means "hard-working women".  They are participating in the poverty elimination program. They are a very close-knit, striving group of 17 women who do their best to grow and succeed. 

Among them, Teodolina stands out. She sells perfumes, and says that she makes her sales through orders, and also has a variety of stock on hand to offer her customers. She is very determined  and does her utmost to be able to improve her living conditions and help her family.

She is asking for this loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of a variety of perfumes, and in this way be able to continue with her sales, striving to improve in her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwanki Village. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ibrahim will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help himearn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.  This season, Ibrahim has grand plans to harvest 50 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be courageous. He operates a motorcycle transport business. His primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a water pump and water pipes for irrigating his farm. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water pump and water pipes for irrigating his farm

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en: Meldred is a 22-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has three years old daughter. Her Husband is a construction worker while she is engaged in buying and selling firewood. They work together for their family. She is asking a loan of PHP4000 to buy firewood to sell. Aside from this, she is planning to uplift their livelihood by doing sari-sari store business. With that, she also plans to buy grocery items out from the money she is requesting, such as candies, chips, biscuits, toiletries, laundry soap, coffee and sugar.

loans.use: to buy firewood, candies, chips, biscuits, toiletries, laundry soap, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells flasks, plates, cups, basins and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flasks, plates, cups, basins and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will expand her business and improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flasks, plates, cups, basins and other items

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is from Payatas Quezon City, Philippines. She has two children, one in elementary level and the other in high school. Josefina and her husband, Reynelio, work together in a buy and sell business. Basically, they sell Therapy Tools and they have different contacts in hospitals and other medical institutions.

Perseverance and passion for the job made her stay in the business. Her inspiration are her children whom she needs to support and raise. The competition on this line of business is what she considers a challenge since it also affects her daily income. However she is grateful for Center for Community Transformation (CCT), Kiva and the lenders who are God’s instruments of blessing to new entrepreneurs like her to succeed in the business. Josefina applied for P12,000 loan as supporting capital, so she can buy additional therapy tools for the business. The amount that she requested will be of great help for the business.

Josefina believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from member’s life changing testimony. She can also share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy additional therapy tools for sale

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be resilient. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Jonavelle

texts.en:
Jonavelle works hard to support her family. Jonavelle is married and has a selling native mats business in the Philippines.

Jonavelle requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more native mats to sell to her customers.

Jonavelle has been in this business for 3 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jonavelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more native mats to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan is a Babban Gona farmer from Dogon Juri Vilage. Alhassan joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhassan will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds.

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Alhassan would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Valeria Judith

texts.es:
Valeria desde pequeña le gustaba ver a sus padres trabajar como comerciantes de su propio negocio y no dudaba en ayudarles cuando lo necesitaban, pues lo miraba como una forma de aprendizaje y como una pasión. Fue entonces cuando decidió que de grande iba a estudiar la licenciatura en mercadeo, estando ahora a sus 24 años de edad en su curso de titulación y a punto de graduarse con honores y trabajando como ejecutiva de ventas en una tienda de ropa.
La motivación por salir adelante, han llevado a Valeria a no detener sus estudios en ningún momento, por esta razón es que solicita un préstamo para cancelar su curso de titulación y los gastos de la graduación. Esto le permitirá expandir sus oportunidades profesionalmente y optar por nuevos empleos. En sus planes está seguir aprendiendo más en otros cursos de educación superior.
texts.en:
Ever since Valeria was a little girl, she liked seeing her parents work as businesspeople with their own business, and she didn't hesitate to help them when they needed it, since she saw it as a form of learning and as a passion. It was then that she decided that when she was grown up she was going to study for a degree in marketing. Now, at the age of 24, she is in her degree course and at the point of graduating with honors and working as a sales executive in a clothing store.

Her motivation for getting ahead has kept Valeria from leaving her studies at any time. It is for this reason that she is applying for a loan to pay for her degree course and the graduation expenses. This will allow her to expand her professional opportunities and opt for new employment. Among her plans is to continue learning more in other higher education courses.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course and graduation expenses.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 47 years old and has four children. Marita is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Marita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marita has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a Babban Gona farmer from Gwani Village. he joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Saidu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his yield.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see increase him increase his income considerably. This season Saidu has ambitious plans to harvest 10 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Saidu now has the opportunity to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sand. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sand for sell. His business goal is to own a lorry for transporting sand within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more sand for selling

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es:
Durante 33 años, Jaime ha trabajado para salir adelante con su familia, por lo que siempre está pendiente de dar lo mejor de sí en la agricultura, por esta razón es que anteriormente había solicitado un préstamo para comprar abono y refrescantes para su cultivo. Él se siente muy agradecido con las personas que le apoyaron, pues sin ese apoyo no puede haber logrado el sin número de resultados positivos.
Esta vez Jaime quiere invertir de nuevo en su nueva siembra, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar gasolina, abono y refrescantes, materiales indispensables para una mejor producción que le permitirá seguir ayudando económicamente a su madre. Al cancelar siempre planea seguir trabajando en el cultivo de maíz y hortalizas.
texts.en:
For 33 years Jaime has worked to get ahead with his family. He is always trying to give the best of himself in agriculture. Because of this he previously asked for a loan to purchase compost, and refreshers for his crops. He feels very appreciative of the people who helped him, without this help he wouldn't have been able to achieve the number of positive results.

This time Jamie wants to invest again in his new crop, so he is asking for a new loan to purchase gasoline, compost and refreshers, indispensable materials for a better production that will allow him to continue helping his mother economically. Upon repaying, he is still planning to continue working with corn and vegetable crops.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, compost and refreshers.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze  is a married woman and staying together with her husband and five children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Pisei's Group

texts.en: Pisei’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Pisei makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bunthorn's Group

texts.en: Bunthorn’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Bunthorn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor and factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
La pasión por el ganado, han llevado a Juan a estar constantemente invirtiendo en este, por lo que la anteriormente había solicitado un crédito para comprar alimentos para sus vacas, lo que le sirvió de mucho para cuidar de estas y que el ganado le produjera mucha leche. Por esto mismo, se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que le ayudaron con ese préstamo, pues si ese no hubiese logrado la meta y tampoco obteniendo excelentes ingresos para su familia. 
Ahora, este hombre emprendedor de 57 años de edad, solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar semillas para sembrar, comprar alimentos para el ganado y pagar a trabajadores que le ayudaran en la nueva cosecha, además de poseer el apoyo incondicional de su familia. Al cancelar este crédito piensa invertir más en el nuevo cultivo para seguir obteniendo mejores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
The passion for the cattle has led Juan to be constantly investing in it, for what he'd previously requested a loan to buy food for his cows which served him well for taking care of them and for the cattle to produce him lots of milk. For this same reason, he feels very grateful to all the people who helped him with this loan, because without it, he wouldn't have achieved the goal nor obtain excellent income for his family.

Now, this enterprising 57-year-old man is requesting a new loan to buy seeds to plant, to buy food for the cattle, and to pay workers that'll help him in the new crop yield, besides having the unconditional support of his family. Upon canceling this loan, he plans to invest more in the new crop to keep obtaining better income for his home.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant, food for the cattle, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Dalia Margarita

texts.es:
Dalia es una joven de tan solo 21 años, que tiene un mundo por delante con grandes metas trazadas, una de ellas es terminar su licenciatura en Química y farmacias, pues desde pequeña se sintió atraída por ese mundo. Ahora, está ya en cuarto año de la carrera y se prepara todos los domingos desde muy temprano para asistir a la universidad. 
No fue hace mucho que Dalia tuvo que vivir el divorcio de sus padres y ver a su madre partir hacia España, situación que tuvo impacto en su vida, pero que la ayudó a querer salir adelante. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo económico de su madre con las remesas. Por esta razón, ella solicita un préstamo para pagar el último semestre de la carrera y unas tutorías que debe tomar. Con esta inversión en su educación, podrá desarrollarse mejor profesionalmente y llegar a cumplir su meta de convertirse en una licenciada que no está muy lejos de establecer su propia farmacia.
texts.en: Dalia is a young girl of only 21 years of age who has her whole life in front of her and has great goals. One of them is to finish her bachelors in Chemistry and Pharmacy, because since she was very young she was attracted by that world. Now, she is already in her fourth year of the career, and she starts getting ready on Sundays to attend college. It was not long ago, that Dalia had to live her parents' divorce and see her mother move to Spain, a situation which impacted her life, but that helped her to want to move ahead. Fortunately, she has her mother's financial support with some remittances. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to pay for her last semester of the career and some private classes that she has to take. With this investment in her education, she will be able to develop herself professionally and reach her goal of becoming certified, and perhaps in a near future to establish her own pharmacy.

loans.use: to pay for the last semester of the career and for some private classes.

loans.name: Celina Isabel

texts.es:
Desde hace ocho años, Celina decidió emprender por cuenta propia en su pulpería, negocio que siempre tuvo en mente y con el cual ha podido salir adelante con su familia.
