loans.use: to buy chorizo and also stocks of Avon products

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, is a 38 years old married woman residing in Tagbilaran City, Bohol.  She sells rtw (ready-to-wear) such as, ladies jeans, t-shirts, pants, whole dress and other apparel. She has three children ages 13,10 and 3 years old respectively.
In addition to that, she engages in food vending business. She buys and sells ready made goods like chorizo, longganisa and lumpia. She has been engaged in that kind of business for 4 years now.

Evangeline has requested a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to buy supplies like shirts, pants, jeans and goods like chorizo(pork chorizo),  longganisa (sausage) and lumpia (are pastries of Chinese origin similar to fresh popiah or fried spring rolls popular in Southeast Asia).  These will help boost her livelihood. Thus, she could sold more rtw and more ready made viand to be sold as well. Her income will augment and she could provide good food to the whole family.  With these she could also support the schooling of her children.

She dreams to expand her business to become  a successful business woman someday.

loans.use: to buy supplies like shirts, pants, jeans and goods like chorizo, longganisa (sausage) and lumpia

loans.name: Kesia

texts.en:
Kesia is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a tree nursery business where she sells seedlings. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more seedlings. Her business goal is to own a tree planting company within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more seedlings.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has five adult children. To earn a living, she is doing a hog raising business. She has been doing this for four years. Aside from this, she also engaged in sari-sari store business. With this, she is asking a loan of PHP5000 to buy feeds and grocery items such as toiletries, spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, sugar, candies, chips and biscuits. In the future, she wishes to improve her means of living. Thus, she wants to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed, toiletries, spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, sugar, candies, chips and biscuits

loans.name: Marka

texts.en:
Marka is a Babban Gona farmer from Gwani Village. she joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Marka no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to move into a bigger home with her family.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see increase her increase her income considerably. This season Marka has ambitious plans to harvest 35 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Marka now has the opportunity to pay for her children's school fees

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields

loans.name: Hashimu

texts.en:
Hashimu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maidawa Village. Hashimu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Hashimu suffered from poor yields that crippled hisability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Hashimu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 20 bags of maize this year, Hashimu can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Queny

texts.en:
Queny is 25 years old and has one child. Queny is married and has one child who is in school.

Queny is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Queny requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Queny has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Queny would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
The person on the photo is Boniface. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. He has undergone all Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise development and record keeping. He is now able to keep business records which helps him manage his incomes well. He also understands his customers better than before. Boniface does vegetable and tomato farming where he sells in the local market.

He is taking Kiva loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm. This will improve his output hence more income to feed his family. He is happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for giving him support and hope in life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for him vegetable farm and therefore boost income

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en: Hannatu is a Babban Gona farmer from Madaki Village. she joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Hannatu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve my yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase her increase her income considerably.  This season Hannatu has ambitious plans to harvest 15 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is the name of the gentleman appearing in the photograph. He is twenty six years old, married and a father of two.
He does maize and beans farming as his economic activity and has greatly benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training which equipped him with skills to effectively manage his business.
He is borrowing from Kiva in order to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and storage sacks. He hopes this will enable him boost his proceeds and hence increase his income. He will therefore be able to improve the living standards of his family which include quality education and modern housing.
Simon is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as  fertilizer and sacks. He hopes this will enable him boost his proceeds and hence increase his income.

loans.name: Lanchenbi Group

texts.en:
Reenaroy is a 37-year-old living in the Bishenpur District of Manipur, India. She has formed a group of six members called Lanchenbi. The group needs a loan of INR 60,000 where every member will get INR 10,000 each. Reena is the leader of this group and she plans to utilize the loan to purchase raw materials for shoe and sandal making. The income earned currently is not enough to run their household expenses and she needs an extra amount to run this business. Currently her household income is INR 7,700. With this loan she will be able to earn up to INR 5,100, which will help her meet the needs of her six family members.

Even though this group has the potential to earn more income, but due to lack of additional capital and financial support they are not able reach their target. With your loan they will expand their businesses and enhance their income earning capacity

loans.use: To buy raw material for her shoe making business

loans.name: Soin Elite Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Rael, a member of Soin Elite self help group. She is sixty seven years old, married and has seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. She acquired skills on enterprise development and financial management training which has enabled her manage the enterprise profitably.

She does maize and beans farming as her economic activity which have helped her meet daily family needs. She is borrowing a loan to buy farm inputs such as top dressing fertilizers to boost her crop yield. This will help her get more income hence be in a position to provide her family with basic needs such as food, shelter and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the great support and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as top dressing fertilizers to boost her crop yield.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Barau Village. Abubakar joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Abubakar suffered from poor yields that crippled hisability to improve my farming skills. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Abubakar has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 30 bags of maize this year, Abubakar can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops for a better harvest.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions,and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Miguelita is 41 years old and has five children who are in school.

Miguelita has a general store business in the Philippines. Miguelita requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Miguelita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Miguelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Kapkatet Umoja Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the in the photo is Winfred, a member Kapkatet Umoja women Group. Winfred is thirty years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014.
Winfred does maize, beans and vegetable farming, having gone through HiH EA enterprise and financial training, she has been able to commercialize her business and earn a profit.

She is taking a kiva loan to buy fertilizer which will increase the quality of her yields thus earn her more income. With increased income Mary will be able to care of her family basic needs, education and medical care.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, this will increase the quality of her yields thus earn her more income.

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.en:
Jhon is a 38 years old married man who has two children, a boy who is 15 and a daughter who is 14; his whole family live in the municipality of Bello in the north of Medellín. His family is the most important thing in the world for him, the reason why started a raising cattle business, which he owns since 2000, and that he learned to work by himself thanks to his love to farm activities. 

He wants to improve his sales so he can get more profits and his business can last in time, he’s aware that if he wants to achieve that he not only has to work really hard, but he has to invest in his business, and right now he doesn’t have the money to do it, that’s the reason why he asked for a loan, so he can buy more pigs and food for them so he has more animals and more to offer. 

He hopes one day, after he has the opportunity to give to his children a good education, he can leave the business to them, but only when it’s a successful one. He also wants to improve his house conditions because they’re not in their best. You can help Jhon accomplish all his dreams through a loan that will let him be closer to that.

loans.use: buy more pigs and food for them

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en:
Ishaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Madak Village. Ishaya joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ishaya suffered from poor yields that crippled hisability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Ishaya has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 60 bags of maize this year, Ishaya can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Alh. Muhammed

texts.en:
Alhaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwanki Village. Alhaji joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhaji will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags.

This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alhaji now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her nine siblings in the countryside of western Rwanda. Due to her tremendous academic record, Yvonne was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because she felt it would help her realize her full intellectual potential.

Yvonne plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, in addition to her career, Yvonne hopes to form a co-op that will support young girls in her community, while also contributing to the education of her younger siblings.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida makes and sell traditonal woven baskets. She is 40-year old married woman with five dependents. Her eldest child is 18 and the youngest is 8. As an additional source of income, she also raises and sells hogs.
Almost six years now that she has been engaged in that kind of business.
Her husband earns a living by being a carpenter. She needs funds to support her both sources of income.

Leonida has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP to buy materials like nito( dried palm), and purchase pig feed and additional piglets. She could cater more orders from her customers and able to improve her hog raising business. Thus, it enables Leonida to provide the basic needs of her family.

She is determined to expand her business to be able to support the schooling of all her children for brighter future.

loans.use: to buy materials like nito( dried palm) for basket weaving and purchase pig feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Madaki Village. Bitrus joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Bitrus will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags.

This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Bitrus now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a dealer and a retailer of a personal collection products like tooth paste, shampoo, powdered soap, and other house hold items. She is 48 year old married woman with no dependents. Aside from that, she also engages in food vending business. She sells ice candy,and banana cue (deep fried banana with caramelized sugar).

She  is asking for a loan to purchase items like powdered soap, fabric conditioners and ingredients like banana and sugar. With the presence of these resources, it will boost the livelihood of Nilda. She could sold more personal collection products and  also cater the orders of her customers. Thus, her income will be stable and she could set aside some of the profit for future use.
 
She would like to expand her both livelihood to open up another possible business ventures to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase items like powdered soap, fabric conditioners and ingredients like banana and sugar

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth has been peddling fresh fish to the local in the community.   She is thirty-three years old married woman with five dependents. Her eldest child is 12 and the youngest is 2. She has been engaged in fish vending business for 5 years now. Her husband is a carpenter.
She is standing in front of  a bucket full of fish with ice on top.

She  is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of fresh fish and ice. It will enable Lilibeth to purchase and sold variety of fresh fish.  With these, her income will augment and these will enables her to provide nutritious meals to the whole family.She could continue send her children to school.

She is grateful for availing the loan and she is willing to work hard to be successful and sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fresh fish and ice

loans.name: Vat's Group

texts.en: Vat’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Vat makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Overcome Challenges - N03Tthanh10Qnham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh is 53 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Thanh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village. The market need is low in this region. Moreover the income from this job is unstable because the amount of fishes they can buy and the price of fish trading depends on the weather conditions. The main hardship that Thanh faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fishes to resell. In 2014, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Thanh is the leader of N03TThanh10QNham, which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn has been peddling fish for almost 4 years now. She buys at the same time sell fresh fish to the neighboring market place . 
She is 26 years old woman with two-year old daughter.She earns three thousand pesos a month by selling fish.
She needs additional capital to finance her small livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to purchase variety of fish.  With the additional capital, it will boost Jonalyn fish vending business and able her to pay her obligations. Thus, she could provide the needs of her growing child.

Jonalyn is hoping that, she could expand her fish vending business to be successful for her to support the welfare of her child and also  to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fish

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is a resident of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her eldest child is 21 and the youngest is 13. She works hard by raising hogs, farming rice and making crab traps. All these require intense outdoor work. 

She is confident that this loan will help her. She will use her loan to buy feed and pay for the labor of the hired help. 

In the future, she plans to build a decent house for her family so that her children can live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy feed and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 39-year-old woman from the municipality of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with seven children, aged two to seventeen.  She has been raising hogs for ten years now to support the needs of her children. 

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. She will also use some of the money to get back the piece of land with coconut trees that she had pledge to someone else. 

She dreams of having children who will become successful someday.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en:
Lak, a farmer living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province is 39 years old and a mother of three children, only one of whom is in school. For 21 years, growing cassava has been the primary source of her family’s income. Moreover, she grows rice to earn extra income to support her living condition. The main challenge for her is her crop has not grown well because it was destroyed by insects and weeds.

For Lak, this her sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has paid back all past loans completely. The previous loans allowed her to earn a better income to support her lifestyle. 

In a group of two, she is the group leader. Now, Lak and her group are seeking a new loan of 4,800,000 KHR to be divided evenly between them. As the leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to produce good yields. 

She hopes that this loan will help her gain more income so that she can improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to produce better crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Это женщина Сафаргул. Ей 54 лет. Она жительница района Пяндж. Сафаргул семейная женщина. Ее дети взрослые и самостоятельные. Старший сын занимается таксистом. Муж Сафаргул занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Сафаргул в районе занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Она продвигает деятельность родителей. Уже 10 лет она занимается этой деятельности. Сафаргул любит доить коров и обеспечить семью с молочными продуктами. Она уверена в себе и хорошо справляется со своей работой. Сафаргул решила расширить животноводческую деятельность, путем увеличения поголовье скота. Для увеличения поголовье скота у нее не хватает денег, и она обратилась за кредитом. Сафаргул надеется на Вашу поддержку. Вы можете поддержать ее!
texts.en:
Safargul is 54 and a resident of the Pyandj district of Tajikistan.  She is a wife and mother; her children are adults and independent.  Her oldest son works as a taxi driver.  Her husband is involved in agriculture.  Safargul herself raises cattle locally, in her own district, thus perpetuating her parents' business.  She has been involved in this activity for ten years already.

Safargul enjoys milking her cows and providing dairy products for her family.  When it comes to her work, she is confident and she experiences no problem.  She has now decided to increase the size of her herd in order to expand her animal husbandry activity.  However, she doesn't have enough money to buy cattle and for this reason she is taking a loan.  She is hoping for your support.  Please help her!

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand her animal husbandry activity.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, debido a la pobreza extrema en la que vivía su familia no siguió estudiando, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domestico, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales dos ya no están en casa porque tienen sus propios hogares y solo uno vive con ellos.

Enrique, se dedica a la agricultura  esta actividad la aprendió desde pequeño, pero además de eso es  caficultor, tiene 35,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de café; las parcelas donde trabaja están en el mismo cantón y tiene que caminar para llegar hasta ese lugar y en los trabajos agricolas se involucran sus dos hijos mayores.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz.

El sueño de Enrique es, poder mejorar su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Enrique, 56, studied up to second grade. Due to the extreme poverty in which his family lived, he did not continue his studies. His partner does the housework, and they have three children. 2 of them do not live with them as they have their own homes, only one child lives with them.

Enrique works in agriculture. He learnt this trade as a young boy, but he also grows coffee. He has 35,000 metres squared of coffee plants. The land where he works is in the same neighbourhood and he has to walk there. His two eldest children help with the agricultural tasks.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies to sow corn.

Enrique's dream is to be able to improve his home to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for sowing corn.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 49 años de edad vive con su padre de 66 años de edad y un sobrino de 15 años de edad al cual apoya en sus estudios. Miguel es un hombre muy trabajador que busca salir adelante ya que se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de licuados y comida frente a una unidad de salud de la zona, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus productos. Miguel solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir más en su negocio, él quiere abrir otro puesto de venta de licuados en otro punto de la comunidad que reside y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos, para los cual invertirá en: licuadoras, frutas, panes, verduras, entre otros productos necesarios para abrir otro local.
texts.en:
Miguel, 49, lives with his father, 66 years old, and a nephew who is 15 years old, whose studies Miguel supports. Miguel is a hardworking man who is looking to get ahead. He has worked for 10 years selling "licuados" (blended drinks similar to smoothies) and food opposite a health centre in the area, so he has a lot of customers who come to buy his products.

Miguel is asking for a loan with FUSAI in order to invest more in his business. He wants to open another milkshake sales point in another part of the community where he lives and so increase his income, which he will then invest in blenders, fruits, breads, and vegetables, among other necessary products to set up another premises.

loans.use: to buy blenders, fruits, breads, etc. to open another premises.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy edible products to resell.

loans.name: The Blithesome - N18T02Tdương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 42 years old and married with one children.  She has operated a food stall selling stuffed pancakes for more than 10 years.  Hương lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need for her pancakes is low in this region. She has no collateral so she can't get loan from other banks or credit institutions.  The main challenge that Hương faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to cook stuffed pancakes for breakfast.
In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  With profits from the business, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her child, and to improve her business.

She is the group leader of the group The Blithesome - N18T02TDương, which consists of 5 members.

loans.use: to purchase materials to cook stuffed pancakes which she sells at her food stall.

loans.name: Heraclea

texts.en: Heraclea is 46 years old and is married with two children. She is still supporting her youngest child who is 16 years old. She and her husband work hard in farming and hog raising to earn a living. She needs help through a loan to buy fertilizer and piglets. Heraclea hopes to expand her business and make it more profitable. Heraclea also dreams that someday she can have enough money to have electricity installed in her house.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and piglets for her farm.

loans.name: Hector Dante

texts.es:
HECTOR TIENE 37 AÑOS, CONVIVIENTE, CON 03 HIJOS. VIVE EN LA COMUNIDAD DE LAGUNAS, EN LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y PESCA.

HECTOR SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SERVICIO COMO JORNALERO AGRICOLA DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS POR ZONA DE RESIDENCIA Y ALREDEDORES, CONYUGE TRABAJA COMO JORNALERA AGRICOLA PERO DE MANERA NO CONTINUA, PRESENTA BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES. CON EL CRÉDITO DARA MANTENIMIENTO A TERRENO AGRICOLA Y PAGARÁ DEUDA, ESTO LE PERMITIRA GENERAR MAYORES INGRESOS, Y POR ENDE MJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
HECTOR is 37 years old and lives with his life partner and their three children. He lives in the community of Lagunas, in the province of Chiclayo, the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Perú. He lives in a community dedicated to business, agriculture, and fishing.

Hector works as an agricultural laborer and has been in this field for 10 years in the region and zone where he lives. His life partner also works as an agricultural laborer but only seasonally. He has good personal references. With the loan he will maintain a plot of land and repay his debt. This will allow him to generate more income and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: maintain a plot of land.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry engages in buying and selling sea cucumber. She is married with three young children aged 2,6 and 11.  Her husband is a fisherman. She makes around three thousand pesos a month from selling sea cucumber. 

Cherry is requesting a loan to buy fishing net, nylon and additional capital for selling sea cucumber. This will help to enhance Cherry's livelihood, improve her husband's catch and help her to provide her family with good food and better shelter.  She could also start to expand her business, settle her obligations and be financially stable in the long run.  She is doing her best to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, nylon and additional capital for sea cucumber

loans.name: Chhim's Group

texts.en:
Chhim is a mother of six children who lives in the Prey Chhor district of the Kampong Cham province.  She is 50-year-old. To support her living, she grows rice and buys recycled items to sell. She has been involved in this business for 32 years. Because of drought, her crop has not grown well and as a result she doesn't have enough working capital to support her business.  So she decided to apply for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  This is her first time applying for a loan with Kiva. 

Chhim and her group member will apply for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer to support her farmland and increase the productivity of her crop yield. She hopes to make extra income so that she can buy a motorbike to drive her to work on time.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer to support her farmland and increase the productivity of her crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mavi Rubenia

texts.es:
Mavi, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en sastrería, ella tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad, los cuales estudian y viven con ellos.

Mavi, tiene una tienda desde hace 4 años, ella comenzó vendiendo bebidas y otro tipo de productos, para poder obtener algunas ganancias y siempre mantuvo la venta de tortillas, antes solo era una líder religiosa, ahora su negocio lo tiene en su casa y su esposo le ayuda con las ventas y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. 

Mavi, utilizara el crédito para comprar bebidas y granos básicos para poder invertir en su tienda, el préstamo le ayuda para que su tienda pueda crecer más en productos y de esa manera poder obtener más ganancias. 

Ella sueña con que sus hijos se preparen académicamente y que su tienda tenga más clientes.
texts.en:
Mavi, 42 years old, studied up to the sixth grade, is married and her husband works as a tailor. She has two children, 16 and 14 years old, who study and live with them.

Mavi has had a shop for 4 years now. She started selling drinks and other types of products, so as to obtain an income and always kept selling tortillas as well. She was previously only a religious leader. Now she tends to her business at home, and her husband helps her with sales. Their opening hours are from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. 

Mavi will use the loan to buy drinks and basic grains to invest in her store. The loan will help her store grow in terms of products, so as to be able to obtain a higher income.

She dreams that her children will get an education and that her shop will have more customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks and basic grains to invest in her store

loans.name: Justa Lucía

texts.es:
Justa es una mujer de 51 años de edad, es feliz mente casada con una linda familia de ocho hijos de las edades entre 10 y 26 años, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad denominada Chuaxic.
Justa para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, desde hace quince años trabaja como agricultora en el campo, a pesar de ser mujer trabajar en el campo para ella no es ningún impedimento, pues con esta labor ha logrado solventar las necesidades de sus hijos. Justa con el afán de seguir sembrando en esta temporada de papa, ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar con ella sus semillas de papa y fertilizantes, porque aunque ella desea sembrar en esta temporada no le es posible. 
Justa tiene las esperanzas puestas en el crédito para hacer posible su siembra y con ello mejorar sus ingresos para construir su casa de terraza.
texts.en:
Justa is a 51 year-old woman who is happily married with a beautiful family of 8 children between the ages of 10 and 26. This beloved family lives in the community of Chuaxic.

Justa has earned a living for the past 15 years by working as an agricultural laborer. She is a strong woman and working in the fields has not been an impediment for her. With this work she has been able to pay for her children's needs. Justa wants to continue planting this season, which is the time for potatoes, and thus has made the decision to request a loan in order to buy potato seeds and fertilizers, because while she wants to plant this season it wouldn't be possible without a loan.

Justa has her hopes set on the loan in order to make planting possible and with that to improve her income in order to build a home.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Khorn is 35 years old and lives in the rural village of Kampong Cham province with her three children who are all in school.  Her main source of income is from raising pigs which she has been doing for 17 years. She also earns some income from growing cassava and rice. She earns up to 36,000 KHR per day. After her family’s expenses, she is able to save around 15,000 KHR each day. But her pigs became sick and the crop did not grow well, resulting in a lower return than she expected. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles already and repaid her previous loans successfully.  She improved her family's living standards through her past loans.  

She is now leading a group of two to apply for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR and her group is seeking of 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer to grow her crop well and to buy more pigs to raise for sale. She hopes to make more income so that she can improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow her crops and buy more pigs to raise for sale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, vitamins, and concentrate to keep up with demand for his products.

loans.name: Teresa Deavila

texts.es:
Teresa, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja de albañil y no tienen hijos y están viviendo en una casa alquilada.

Teresa, desde que se acompaño hace dos años, decidieron colocar una tienda de productos de 
primera necesidad, porque en la zona donde viven no hay tiendas cerca y por eso venden bastante.
 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar estantes para colocar los productos, porque actualmente los tiene en el suelo y en canastas, de esa manera lograr dar una presentación más formal a su negocio y los productos sean vistos por los clientes.
 
El sueño de Teresa, es seguir trabajando y ahorrar para poder tener lo necesario para cuando tengan hijos.
texts.en:
30 year old Teresa studied up to a bachelor's degree. She has a partner who works as a mason and they don't have children. They live together in a rented house.
When Teresa met her partner 2 years ago, they decided to open a store selling staple goods because, in the area where they live, there aren't any convenient stores. Consequently, sales are pretty good.
She needs the loan to buy shelves to display their products because they are currently on the floor and in baskets. In this way, they will be able to achieve a more upmarket presentation for their business and the products will be more visible to their customers.
Teresa's dream is to keep working and save so that she will have what she needs for when they have children.

loans.use: to buy shelves to display her products.

loans.name: Lucy Ondina

texts.es:
Lucy tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijo de edades de 22 y 17 años,obtuvo su título de secundaria como secretaria y perito mercantil y contador publico, seguidamente comenzó sus actividades laborales, medio que le ha permitido iniciar una carrera universitaria la que hoy en día está por culminar con 14 clases restantes en la carrera de Psicología con Orientación Empresarial.
Se desempeña como asistente de presidencia en una institución dedicada al apoyo de empresas que se encuentran en el sector industrial.
Es una joven paciente, que confía en Dios y en sus capacidades como persona y como profesional, es amable muy carismática y con un corazón noble, ama la vida y a su familia quien ha sido el respaldo durante todo este largo tiempo, su motivación principal es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, y poder brindarles una mejores oportunidades de superación a cada uno de sus hijos.
Lucy menciona que su aporte al desarrollo del país es mediante la educación, ya que es sinónimo de progreso y de nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento mediante conocimientos.
Menciona lo difícil que es poder terminar los estudios universitarios, cuando hay problemas económicos de por medio, pero siempre hay una luz de esperanza cuando se quiere lograr cualquier meta encaminada al éxito, se siente feliz de poder tener un apoyo de financiamiento para sus estudios.
Como meta, Lucy desea obtener un mejor salario y desempeño profesional una vez culminada su carrera universitaria, desea formar su propia empresa y ser una instructora empresarial que pueda ser portadora de nuevas ideas a los micro-empresarios.
"Lo mejor es darle tiempo al tiempo, ya que lo que es para uno llegará con esfuerzo acompañado de fe"
-Lucy Puerto.
texts.en:
Lucy is 42 years old. She is the mother of 2 children who are 22 and 17 years old. She earned her high school certificate working as a secretary and commercial expert and public accountant. Her work has enabled her to start a college career that today is almost complete. She has 14 classes remaining in order to get her degree in Psychology with a Concentration in Business.
She acts as assistant to the President of an institution that supports businesses in the industrial sector.
She is a patient young woman who has faith in God and her capacities as a person and a professional. She is kind and very charismatic and has a noble heart. She loves life and her family, which has been her support during all this long time. Her main motivation is to have better living conditions for her family and to be able to offer better opportunities to get ahead to each of her children.
Lucy mentions that her contribution to the country's development is through education as this is synonymous with progress and new opportunities to grow through knowledge.
She says that her difficulty is being able to finish her university studies when she has economic problems. But, there is always the light of hope when she wants to achieve a goal and is aimed at success. She feels happy to have financial support for her studies.
Lucy's goal is to obtain a better salary and work as a professional when she has finished her university degree. She wants to start her own business and be a business instructor who can share new ideas with micro-enterepreneurs.
"It is best to give it time, as it will come with faith and effort."
Lucy

loans.use: to finance her degree in psychology.

loans.name: Soucounda's Group

texts.fr:
Crée le 02 juillet 2008, le banc villageois est composé de femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles sont très dynamiques, elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenu du petit commerce à l’agriculture. Il existe une bonne entente entre les membres du groupe.

Madame Soucounda (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles et 3 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente du jus naturel à base de bissab et pain de singe et d’arachide grillée.  Elle  s’approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires par sac. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Elle désire acheter 3 sacs de pain de singe 50 kg 2 à 3 bassine de bissab et 1 sac de 50 kg de sucre et divers colorants alimentaires.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la gestion du foyer, des soins médicaux et frais de scolarité d’une part et d’autre part accroitre son épargne.
texts.en:
Created on 2 July 2008, this banc villageois is made up of women who all live in the same village. They are very dynamic and work in commerce and agriculture. The group members get along well with each other.

Soucounda (who is seated on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 49 years old and the mother of five children--two daughters and three sons. She works selling natural juices made from hibiscus, baobab fruit, and grilled groundnuts. She procures her ingredients in the weekly markets by the sac. She does well in her work.

She wishes [with her loan] to buy three 50-kilogram sacs of baobab fruit, three tubs of hibiscus, one 50-kilogram sac of sugar, and various food colorings.

Earnings will allow her to support her husband to take care of the household and their children's healthcare and school fees. The rest will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy baobab fruit, hibiscus, sugar, and various food coloring.

loans.name: Yenifer Cristabel

texts.es:
Yenifer, de 20 años de edad, estudio bachillerato en turismo, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja vendiendo cd's, tienen un niño de ocho meses de nacido.

Yenifer, desde que se acompaño, se dedica a vender refrescos y por las tardes pasteles junto a su madre, quien le apoya mucho y es quien le inculco a iniciar el negocio y vende de lunes a sábado.
 
El préstamo lo solicita para comprar una cocina de leña y sartenes para preparar sus pasteles de carne, porque en la cocina de gas es muy lento y se consume mucho gas.
 
El sueño de Yenifer, es que su hijo tenga todo lo que necesita y seguir apoyandondole a su pareja.
texts.en:
Yenifer is 20 years old. She is studying for a bachelor's degree in tourism. She has a partner who works selling CDs. They have a 9 month old baby.
Yenifer, when she met her partner, decided to sell refreshments and, in the afternoon, pastries. She does this along with her mother who supports her a lot and who inspired her to start the business. They sell from Monday to Saturday.
The loan will be used to buy a wood-burning oven and pans to prepare meat pies because they cook very slowly in a gas oven and use a lot of gas.
Yenifer's dream is that her son has all that he needs and to keep supporting her partner.

loans.use: to buy a wood-burning oven and pans to prepare meat pies.

loans.name: Moryanogo Group

texts.fr:
Mme KADIGUETA est la représentante du groupe MORYANOGO. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge. 
Mme fait de l’agriculture depuis  05 ans. Elle pratique aussi l’élevage. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 01 sac d’engrais et 02 boîtes d’herbicide.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité et s’occuper de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Kadigueta is the representative of the Moryanogo group. She is married and the mother of four children. The eldest child is 15 years old while the youngest is four years old. One of the children goes to school. Kadigueta takes care of six people.

Kadigueta has been farming for five years. She also works raising livestock. She procures her materials from the surrounding markets.

With this loan, she plans to buy one sac of fertilizer and two boxes of herbicide.

She wants to use the earnings from the loan to strengthen her farming and take care of her children. She dreams of buying a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy one sac of fertilizer and two boxes of herbicide.

loans.name: Cinthia Lisbeth

texts.es:
CINTHIA TIENE 22 AÑOS, SOLTERA, SIN HIJOS A SU CARGO VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PADRES, EN EL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGIO LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ. DICHA COMUNIDAD SE DEDICA MAYORMENE A LA AGRICULTURA, COMERCIO Y GANADERIA.

CINTHIA ES CONOCIDA EN EL MEDIO POR SU LABOR DE AYUDANTE DE COCINA DESDE HACE MAS DE 04 AÑOS Y ADICIONALMENTE TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA COMO ES AVON, PERSONA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES COMO TAMBIEN LABORALES, FAMILIA UNIDA. NECESITA PRESTAMO PARA COMPRA DE INSUMO PARA LA PREPARACION DE SUS ALIMENTOS, DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO Y PODER FORMLIZARLO Y DE ESA MANERA PERCIBIR MAYOR INGRESO EN BIENESTAR DE SU UNIDAD FAMILIAR..
texts.en:
Cinthia is 22 years old, single, and without dependent children. She lives in the house of her parents, in the district of Cayaltí, of the province Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. Said community makes a living primarily in agriculture, trade and livestock.

Cinthia is known for her work as a kitchen assistant for more than 4 years, and additionally she makes a living in the sale of beauty products such as Avon. She is a person with good personal as well as work references. She needs a loan for the purchase of inputs for the preparation of her foods, and in this way she is able to grow her business and be able to formalize it and thus receive a higher income for the wellbeing of her household.

loans.use: to purchase inputs for the preparation of her foods.

loans.name: Patricia Maria

texts.es:
Patricia, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, se divorció hace varios años, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales trabajan y uno estudia, con ella vive solo uno de sus hijos.

Patricia, administra un puesto de comida rápida desde hace más de nueve años, ella empezó el negocio por iniciativa propia y se dio cuenta que era una buena forma de obtener ingresos para mantener a la familia; el puesto de comida rápida, está en el centro de ciudad y ella vive cerca porque a veces tiene que pagar transporte para llevar producto desde la casa al negocio.

Patricia, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos como papas, frutas para los licuados naturales y refrescos, sodas, pan para hamburguesas, carne, etc. esto le ayudara a tener más capital, para poder invertir y no quedarse sin inventario en el negocio, ya que ha sido de esta forma como ella a hecho crecer el negocio.

El sueño de Patricia, es que el negocio siga creciendo y poder implementar otro local para cubrir más territorio.
texts.en:
43 year old Patricia studied up to her bachelor's degree. She got divorced some years ago and has 2 children who work and one also studies. One of her children lives with her.
Patricia runs a fast food stall and has been doing this for more than 9 years. She began the business on her own initiative and found that it was a good way to make an income to raise her family. The fast food stall is in the center of the city and she lives nearby as she sometimes has to pay for transportation to carry her products from home to her business.
Patricia needs the loan to buy supplies such as potatoes, fruits for natural juices, sodas, bread for hamburgers, meat, etc. This will help her to have more capital so that she can invest in supplies and not be left without inventory in the business. This is how she has been able to grow the business.
Patricia's dream is that the business will keep growing and that she will be able to open another location to cover more territory.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as potatoes, fruits for the natural juices, sodas, bread for hamburgers, meat, etc.

loans.name: Ganiyatou

texts.fr: Ganitatou est une femme mariée âgée de 24 ans résidant à Agoè. Mère de deux enfants, Ganiyatou est une revendeuse de chaussures qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend  dans les quartiers environnant. Ganiyatou sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de séries de chaussures afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en:
Ganitatou is a married woman who is 24 years old and lives in Agoe. She is the mother of two children.

Ganiyatou works selling shoes that she buys twice a month from a market and resells in the surrounding areas. She is seeking this loan to order boxes of shoes so as to respond better to her customers' needs.

She also wants to have enough financial independence to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy boxes of shoes two times.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi, 26, is a simple and optimistic housewife living at Falakata. She is the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is studying in grade 1 and her daughter is too small to go to school.

Her husband runs a grocery shop where the residents of the local area and their neighborhood get their supply of grocery items and other necessities. After managing household work, Madhabi also helps her husband in selling the grocery items.

Unfortunately, the income is hardly enough to make ends meet because they have a limited stock in their grocery store. Now the couple needs to increase the stock of supplies at their store, which will help to enhance the earnings.

Madhabi feels it is urgent to expand their store with more groceries for good revenue, so she applied for a loan from BJS, partner of Kiva to purchase more inventories like rice, oil, salt, flour, spices and other daily necessities in bulk to expand her business.

She is hopeful that she will provide a better education to her children and financial stability in her family with the expansion of her business. The increased income will help her to be confident to achieve her goals.

She thanks BJS and Milaap, their benefactor.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of inventory for her husband’s grocery shop.

loans.name: Denia Carolina

texts.es:
La joven  Denia Carolina de 31  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de Útiles escolares, vende libretas, cuadernos, lápices, papel bon, folder, grapadoras, etc. también cuenta con su propia fotocopiadora y laminadora  para el servicio de sus clientes.
Doña Denia Carolina vive en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como papel bon, papel oficio, cuadernos de varios tipos y tamaños, lápices, etc. para surtir su negocio con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente   con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -  Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
Young Denia Carolina, 31 years old, lives with her husband and children at a house of her own. She has worked for 5 years now in the business of school supplies sales. She sells notebooks, workbooks, pencils, bond paper, folders, staplers, etc. She also has her own photocopier and laminator for the service of her customers.

Denia Carolina lives in a community in the southern part of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with a desire to succeed and struggles day by day to improve her quality of life. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of products such as bond paper, legal-sized paper, workbooks of various types and sizes, pencils, etc. to stock her business. With the help of this loan, she aims to improve her income and also her quality of life.

Denia Carolina is a subsequent client with a desire to work with Prisma. Her dream is to have a good and well-stocked business and at the same time improve her future alongside her family.


San Lorenzo, Honduras- July, 2015

loans.use: to buy bond paper, workbooks, pencils, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Pilar, está preparando su tesis, para así poder recibirse y lograr la meta tan anhelada que es la de ser una profesional exitosa que ayude a la sociedad.
Está estudiando para poder ser una licenciada y por medio de sus conocimientos poder ayudar a sus seres queridos mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Pilar and she is preparing her thesis. She is anxious to finish her degree and achieve the longed for goal of becoming a successful professional who helps society.

She is studying to be a lawyer and through her knowledge to be able to help her loved ones improve their quality of life.

She is asking for this loan in order to pay tuition and in this way continue studying and struggling toward her goals.

loans.use: to pay college tuition

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. 
Está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y con lucha está tratando de ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Alvaro is from the city of Paraguarí. He is a very hard-working person who makes an effort to improve his quality of life and that of his loved ones.

He is studying nursing, and through hard work he is trying to be someone in life.

He is asking for this loan in order to pay tuition for his degree in nursing and in this way continue his studies as he has in the past.

loans.use: pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Unicent

texts.en:
Unicent, 39, is a married man with four children.

He makes his living by growing coffee. Inadequate capital and a prolonged drought resulting in low-quality coffee to take to market are major challenges for him. He wants to develop his farm further, but he still has his children to look after and pay their school fees.

Unicent has applied for a 1,500,000 UGX loan through Kiva's field partner Hofokam to buy more coffee to sell. This will help him boost his earnings.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr: Adzovi est une femme mariée âgée de 47 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Ayant quatre enfants à charge, Adzovi  se bat pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des  paniers tissés, des vannes et  des produits d’alimentations générales. Pour s’approvisionner, Adzovi se rend deux fois par mois au marché pour commander des paniers tissés, vannes et des sacs de riz dont elle désire ce prêt pour en faire usage. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Adzovi  va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adzovi is a married woman who is 47 years old and lives in Adidogome. Having four children under her care, she works to earn a living by reselling woven baskets, lengths used for wickerwork, and general food products.

To procure her stock, Adzovi travels twice a month to the market to order woven baskets, lengths used for wickerwork, and rice. It is for this reason she wants a loan.

With the profits, Adzovi is going to be able to help her husband with the family's daily expenses and to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy woven baskets, lengths used for wickerwork, and rice.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman who has been blessed with three children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Halima has operated a poultry selling business for over five years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Halima dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
Rosana estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, es Recepcionista en una empresa, y a la vez estudia para poder ser una buena administradora de empresas,
Sueña con poder ser una exitosa administradora e implementar en su propia compañía sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de sus útiles de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Rosana is studying and working at the same time. She is a receptionist at a company, and at the same time she is studying to be a good business manager. She dreams of becoming a successful manager and implementing her knowledge in her own company. She is requesting this loan to pay for the expenses of college needed items, and in this way to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for needed items for college.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en: Phy’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Phy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sav's Group

texts.en: Sav’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.  Sav makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman who lives together with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a fuel selling business. She sells at retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase a stock of fuel for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of fuel for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 120 hens and feed.

loans.name: Heroinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado HEROINAS está en su ciclo número dos del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, ellas son mujeres luchadoras que se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirian quien realiza crochet, hace todo tipo de bordados, los hace sobre pedidos y sobre modelos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y con ello poder ayudar a su familia con mejores condiciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar hilos, agujas, bastidores y otros, para poder seguir con su crochet, y cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en: The group called HEROINAS is in their second loan cycle of the women's committee program, where all of them work and help each other to move ahead. They are hardworking woman who came together to be able to improve their life situation and that of their loved ones. One of the members is Mirian, who makes crochet work. She makes all types of embroidery, getting orders and following patterns. She is a very hardworking person who is struggling to be able to improve her life situation, and with it to be able to help her family with better situation. She is requesting this loan to buy threads, needles, frames and other things, to continue making crochet and fulfill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, frames, and other things, to be able to continue with her crochet work.

loans.name: Grydia

texts.en:
In the Philippines, if you want to start your own business at home, one of the top pick is Direct Selling. In this business, an entrepreneur becomes a reseller of a company. The company provides the necessary brochure that shows various products like ready-to-wear clothes for men & women, foot wears, make ups, appliances and items for personal use. A signed up registration form and minimal membership fee qualify an individual to become a reseller. Most mothers who are busy with their families are engaged in this type of business since most of their customers are just their neighbors and friends. Basically its viability depends on the reseller's talent to persuade the customers.

In every business, patience and perseverance are major key to success. Like Grydia, one of the partners of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), she doesn't have high capital for the business but she has passion and dedication to be successful. That’s why Grydia is thankful that CCT granted the loan that she applied previously. She also wants to thank Kiva and lenders for helping her on the business by considering her story and by donating certain amounts. 

This year, Grydia wants to apply for another loan of P13,000 to have additional products on display. Availability of the products is an important thing to consider, so customers will not wait for weeks just to have the product. Grydia is anticipating that her request will be granted.

Despite being busy managing the business, Grydia  spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually, hear testimonies from other CCT partners, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell like soap, dish-washing liquids, detergents and other similar products

loans.name: Tonghou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est créé en juillet  2008, il est composé de femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Soucieuses de leur condition de vie, elles mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenu comme le petit commerce et l’agriculture.

Madame Tonghou (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42ans est mariée mère de 5enfants dont 1 garçon et 4filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de graines servant à faire du « netetou » (assaisonnement traditionnel), et  des balaies qu’elle revend dans les villages environnant et frontaliers. Elle jouit d’une expérience de plus de 3ans. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des graines de netetou, dont 3 sacs, voir plus qui varie entre 75 et 100 kg le sac.

Avec ses bénéfices elle assure parfois la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created in July 2008 and is composed of women who live in the same village. Concerned about their living conditions, they all work in small-scale commerce and agriculture.

Tonghou (who is seated on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of five children--one son and four daughters.

Tonghou works selling seeds used to make netetou (a traditional seasoning) and brooms in the surrounding villages and areas. She has done this for more than three years.

With this new loan, she plans to buy three sacs of netetou seeds, which vary between 75 and 100 kilograms per sac.

With her earnings she will contribute to taking care of the daily expenses and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy netetou seeds.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 47 years old and is a married woman. She deals in business selling milk where she makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 60000 to purchase another buffalo. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Mevludi

texts.en:
Mevludi is 57 years old. He lives in the small village Taleri with his wife and son. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have 2 cows and 3 calves and produce dairy products to sell. In addition, they have 0.5 hectare agricultural land, where they grow nut trees.

Mevludi wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up Program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 6300 GEL to purchase a truck. Once the truck is purchased, he will start to trade wood. This will increase his family income and Mevludi will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. He is very hardworking and hopes that the business will be profitable. Mevludi awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a truck and be able to start trading wood.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is fifty six years old. He is married and has seven children.

Leonard owns a commercial toilet and bath house facility, used by many residents in his community. He has operated this business for six years. Whenever he pulls the toilet from the sewage, he ends spilling the mess in his house, because the pipes are not long enough to prevent the spillage. The stand he has made, which supports his water storage tank, is severely cracked and might also collapse and the tank might burst too.

It is for this reason he is requesting for this loan to reconstruct the storage tank stand and also buy the pipes to extend the sewage line to prevent spillage. He is hopeful that this will help him to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy pipes and connect them to commercial sewer drain for easy removal and to repair a cracked poly tank stand.

loans.name: Katanga Farmers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Josphine, a member of Katanga Farmers. She is 54 years old and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2012 so as to benefit from the trainings, especially in enterprise development.

She operates a general retail shop and also does tailoring. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more flour, sugar, bar soaps, salt, packed milk among others in order to add stock and increase sales. She intends to use the profits to buy more school uniforms tailoring materials and hence boost her tailoring business. With increased income, she will be able to feed her family as well as pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more food to add stock to her general retail shop for increased income and use those profits to boost her tailoring shop and buy food and pay school fees.

loans.name: Kshiroda

texts.en:
Kshiroda, 37, hails from Falakata in Alipurduar district. She is a housewife and is a mother of three daughters. She lives with her husband, Subhas, and her daughters in their own kachha house. In her young age she could not continue her education after ninth grade, but she is providing education to their daughters. They are in college, grade 9 and grade 1.

Kshiroda's husband runs an agribusiness. He grows vegetables and sells in the local market. He is the only breadwinner of the family. It is hardly possible for him to bear his children's educational expenses because the profit he earns from his business is spent on food expenses.

Their 17-year-old daughter, Urmila, is a student of B.A. (Part 1) at Falakata College. Coming from a low-income background, she is not equipped with enough educational articles and her parents are unable to pay her private tuition fees and college fees. She is striving hard to complete her graduation and joint nursing training course because her aim is to be a nurse.

So Kshiroda seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) that she will use for purchasing educational materials and paying for college fees and private tuition fees. Kshiroda hopes this loan will help her daughter to get an uninterrupted education.

Kshiroda and her daughter, Urmila (in the picture), are grateful to both BJS and Kiva for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase educational articles and pay for the college fees and private tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a single man and he operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads.

He will use the Kes 32,000 loan to buy materials to construct his house. His business goal is to own a matatu within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a fleet of matatus . This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct his house

loans.name: Melvit

texts.en:
Melvit works hard to support her family. Melvit is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Melvit requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Melvit has been in this business for 11 years now.

Melvit would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, gasoline, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Abashyizehamwe Acb Group

texts.en:
Diane is the group leader; aged 25 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 5 years. 1 of them goes to school. The group is called ABASHYIZEHAMWE means “Solidarity” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for changing to a better future.

She has a shop and has been running a business for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to buy medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Gwani Village. John joined Babban Gona to expand his  farm and grow his  agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, John will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, John now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to build a house/ renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma, 26, is a mother of a son and hails from a small village Nabanagar, in Falakata. She lives there with her husband and son in a small kaccha house, made of mud and straw. Her son is below school age.

Her husband is a farmer by profession. He cultivates various vegetables in his farmland in different seasons and sells them to the local market. Asma assists her husband in his field work after managing her household work.

Now they have decided to cultivate paddy rice in their farmland. This is an all-season crop, and being the staple food of West Bengal, has much demand throughout the year. So they think it will be a profitable business that will give them good revenue.

As they have no funds to invest, Asma is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides etc. to grow paddy rice on their farmland.

She has a lot of faith and hope of getting better income for going ahead with the agribusiness, because this is their sole source of income. She is hopeful that her family finance will increase to enable them to lead a decent life. With her profits, she plans to purchase more land in the future to expand this business.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for growing paddy rice.

loans.name: Las Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Unidas lo integran 16 mujeres, están en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para el progreso, como un mecanismo de mejorar sus vidas, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Herminia quien se dedica a la venta de frutas de estación y frescas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con lucha y esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante. Su meta es poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener y así evitar que pasen por necesidades.
La Sra. Herminia con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de más frutas variadas, como ser bananas, manzanas, piñas, sandias y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Las Unidas group is made up of 16 women. They are in their first round of the women's committee program in which everyone and helps each other progress, a mechanism to improve their lives. They are participating in the poverty elimination program, fighting and making an effort to improve their quality of life.

One of the members is Herminia, who earns a living selling fresh fruits that are in season. She is a very hardworking woman, who through struggling and a lot of effort has been able to succeed. Her goal is to be able to give her family everything she couldn't have, and avoid suffering hardships.

With this loan, Herminia will invest in the purchase of more fruits, like bananas, apples, pineapples, watermelons, and others, to be able to continue with her sales as she has been.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell, like bananas, apples, pineapples, watermelons, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, seasoning and other products.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
Sokchea, 51, is a farmer from a remote area of Mondulkiri province and she is a married mother who has eight children, five of whom depend on her and one of whom is in school and needs support.
