To make a living, she is growing cassava as the main source of income. She sometimes works as a paid worker to get supplemental income to complement her family’s needs. The decline of crop price is the main challenge to the business.

Due to a lack of working capital, Sokchea formed a group of three members to apply for a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan that was fully paid back enabled her to uplift her lifestyle and better support her family’s needs. Sokchea, who is the group leader, will use her loan to buy weedicide and organic pesticide for the farmland. She hopes to get more income so as to fulfill her dream of building a new house to live in.

loans.use: to buy weedicide and organic pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Guadalupe, son 18 mujeres de la ciudad de Concepción, son de una zona alejada de la capital del país, ellas luchan para poder tener un mejor acceso a su ciudad, y también para poder dar a sus familias una mejor vida.
La Sra.  Yolanda es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su local de venta de plantas donde ella misma se encarga de producir, ella es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, ya que gracias a sus plantas se ha formado ya una clientela grande. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de herramientas para su local y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
This group is called "Guadalupe" and has 18 members (all women) from the city of Concepción, far from the capital. The women are working hard to have better access to the capital, and to be able to give their families a better life.

Yolanda is a member of the group. She has a stall selling plants that she herself grows. Yolanda is very good at what she does and has a large customer base as a result. Yolanda is very hard-working and is fighting to move forward and help her family.

Yolanda is applying for this loan in order to buy tools for her business, and thereby continue expanding it. She can thus give her family everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy tools for growing plants.

loans.name: Mujeres Bendecidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Bendecidas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están muy contentas con esta propuesta de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Maria es una de las que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a hacer comidas que después sale a vender de manera ambulante por su barrio, ya tiene una clientela que siempre compra de ella todo lo que vende, y de esa forma se gana la vida de una manera digna y sin privaciones. Maria quiere dar a sus seres queridos muchas cosas que ella no pudo tener.
Ella quiere comprar verduras, carne, pollo, embutidos y otros, de manera a poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Bendecidas" group is on its first loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme, where all the members are very happy with proposals to improve theirs and their families' living conditions.

María is one member of this group: she makes a living selling meals as a street vendor in her local barrio. She has customers who always buy everything she sells, and the work allows her earn a living in order to have a decent life where she needs for nothing. María wants to give her loved ones the many things that she could not have.

María wants to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, cold meats, and other supplies in order to continue delighting her customers with her delicious meals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, cold meats, and other supplies for making meals.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 8 de diciembre es un grupo nuevo que se formó para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en equipo y sumado a las capacitaciones que brinda la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Señorita Johana quien se dedica a la confección de prendas artesanales tales como: Gorras de lana y de hilo, chalecos de lana e hilo tanto largos como cortos, entre otros. A través del esfuerzo que hace, brinda a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
La Señorita Johana solicita este préstamo para la compra de mayor Cantidad de insumos como ser Hilos y Telas  lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio y a mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The "8 de diciembre" loan group is a new group that has been created in order for the (all female) members to help each other through their work. Working together, they will bring together their training from Fundación Paraguaya.

One member of the group is Johana, who makes a living producing handicrafts, such as woolen and thread hats, long and short tops, and more. Through her hard work, Johana provides her family with a decent life where they need for nothing.

Johana is applying for this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of threads and material for needlework in bulk. This will help her to realise her business plan and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy threads and material for needlework in bulk.

loans.name: Monariya Group

texts.es:
Este comité se unió en la ciudad de Encarnación, son mujeres sacrificadas, que vieron la oportunidad de mejorar sus vidas a través del programa de la fundación paraguaya en apoyo con el programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Entre las integrantes se destaca las integrantes Gloria quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados en una galería, donde día a día vende a los clientes que pasan por allí. Gloria es una mujer muy luchadora que poco a poco ha ido mejorando su calidad de vida, y la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya les ha abierto el camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas y calzados variados, para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando y luchando por crecer cada día.
texts.en: This committee got together in the city of Encarnacion. They are dedicated women who saw the opportunity to improve their lives through the Paraguayan foundation program to eliminate poverty. Among the members we have Gloria, who works selling clothing and footwear in a shopping district, where day after day she sells to people walking by. Gloria is a hard working woman who, little by little has improved her quality of life with the help of the Paraguayan foundation who opened the way for her. She asks for a loan to buy clothing and varied footwear to supply her business and thus continue improving and struggling to grow every day.

loans.use: To buy clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Katupyry está en el ciclo 14 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y lo quiere lograr a través de las capacitaciones que la fundación paraguaya va dando por medio de sus programas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucía ella  es cliente de la Fundación, se desempeña como tesorera del comité, se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, y que después las vende en su barrio. Lucía es una mujer muy sacrificada que día a día empieza su trabajo desde muy tempranas horas, y termina ya muy entrada la tarde, comenta que con su trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna y les da a sus seres queridos lo que necesitan.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir creciendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Katupyry" group is on its 14th cycle as part of the women's committee programme, where each member is part of the poverty elimination programme too. Every member wants to improve their living conditions through training offered through Fundación Paraguaya's programmes.

One member of the group is Lucia, a borrower at Fundación Paraguaya, and treasurer of the group. She makes a living selling meals that she herself prepares and then sells in her local barrio. Lucía is a very dedicated woman who, every day, starts work very early and finishes late in the afternoon. She says that she earns a living through her work, providing her with a decent life and giving her loved ones what they need.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, baked goods and more. She can thereby improve her living conditions and continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, baked goods and more.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres Luchadoras, ya que eso es lo que son, mujeres luchadoras que desean mejorar sus vidas a través de la unión de todas, y por medio del trabajo en equipo. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por crecer y mejorar sus vidas. 
La Sra. Felipa, es una  las integrantes, quien se dedica a vender bebidas variadas, es muy buena en las ventas, y es por ello que le está yendo muy bien, y con su trabajo ayuda a sus seres queridos. Felipa desde muy joven ha trabajado y se ha esforzado, y gracias a eso se ha ganado la vida y da a su familia una vida digna.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas variadas, como gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en: The group's name is Struggling Women because that is what they are, struggling women who want to improve their lives by getting together and working as a team. They are part of the program for the elimination of poverty, trying to grow and improve their lives. Mrs. Felipa is a member who sells a variety of beverages. She is good in sales and that is why she is doing well, as she helps her loved ones with her work. She has worked and struggled since very young and, thanks to this,  she has earned a living and gives her family a dignified life. She is asking for a loan to buy diverse beverages such as carbonated drinks, wines, beer, and others, to be able to continue with her sales and meet her clients requests.

loans.use: to buy diverse beverages to sell: carbonated drinks, wines, beer and others.

loans.name: Prami

texts.en:
At the age of 43 years, Prami looks after her three children (two sons and one daughter) and husband, and does all the household work. She lives in a remote village named Parangerpar in Alipurduar district. She is married to Nitai, who is a farmer by profession. Her eldest son studied up to grade seven and now is engaged in shuttering work, and her other son studied up to ninth grade.

Prami's husband usually earns very little, which is only enough for their daily household expenses. So, it is hardly possible for them to continue the educational expenses of their only daughter. Their daughter Purnima, aged 14 years, is a student in grade nine in Falakata Subhash Girls' High school. She is a diligent and intelligent student, but due to the lack of adequate study materials and proper guidance, she did not score well in her last exam. Her parents are facing problems to provide her with minimum educational support due to their financial problem. But, they hope Purnima will finish her education smoothly and reach her goals.

So, Prami has taken an educational loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for her daughter's education. She plans to purchase necessary articles like pens, pencils, a geometry box, books, notebooks, a uniform, etc. and pay the private tuition fees and school fees for her daughter so that she does not face any problem and finishes her study smoothly.

Prami and her daughter Purnima (in the picture) are very much grateful to both their lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to cover the educational expenses of her daughter.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 1 se formaron en la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron con el propósito de mejorar sus vidas y también darles a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener.
La señora Adela, ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de comidas que realiza en su casa, comenta que ya tiene muchos clientes que día a día se acercan a su casa a comprar lo que ella prepara y vende. El  fin del préstamo es tener más capital  para el mejoramiento de su cocina ya que necesita una mayor comodidad para poder dar a sus clientes mejores comidas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y crecer.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa is in its first cycle. The group was formed in the city of Caacupé, They are mothers that are the heads of their families. They got together in order to improve their lives and to give their loved ones everything that they were not able to have.

Adela helps to support her family by selling food that she makes at her house. She says that she now has a lot of customers who come, day to day, to her house to buy what she makes and sells.

The object of the loan is to have more capital to improve her kitchen. She needs increased comfort in order to be able to give her customers better food. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve and grow.

loans.use: to make her kitchen more comfortable.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN CASADO, SU FAMILIA LA CONFORMAN SU ESPOSA Y DOS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS, TAMBIÉN APOYA ECONÓMICAMENTE A SU PADRE QUIEN ES VIUDO, SU PAPA QUIEN ES DIABETICO DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS SUFRE DE UNA HERNIA UMBILICAL, ACTUALMENTE SUFRE DE FUERTES DOLORES PORQUE LA HERNIA HA CRECIDO, POR LO QUE LE URGE UNA OPERACIÓN YA QUE CORRE EL RIESGO DE QUE SE LE ATASQUE EN EL INTESTINO Y SE ESTRANGULE POR LO QUE SU VIDA ESTARÍA EN RIESGO.
texts.en: He ia a married, young man.  His family consists of his wife and two small children.  He also financially supports his father, who is a widower.  His father, who is diabetic, has had an umbilical hernia for several years.  He is now suffering from severe pain because the hernia has grown.  Therefore, it is urgent that he has an operation because he runs the risk that it will obstruct and strangle his intestine.  This would put his life at risk.

loans.use: to pay for a hernia operation.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rita está integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas, que quieren mejorar sus vidas a través de la unión y el trabajo en equipo. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se sacrifican por sus seres queridos.
La señora Ermelinda tiene una Frutería que montó en su casa, monto el pequeño negocio con mucho sacrificio, y poco a poco ha ido mejorándolo. El  fin del préstamo es para mejorar las instalaciones de su frutería y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
Ermelinda está luchando por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos a través de su trabajo y su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
The group Santa Rita is made up of 15 hard-working and sacrificing women who want to improve their lives through their group and by working as a team. They are heads of their households who do everything for their loved ones.

Emelinda has a fruit stand that she runs out of her house. She started her small business with great sacrifice, and little by little it has been growing. The purpose of the loan is to fix up her fruit stand which will allow her to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

Emelinda is struggling to get ahead and help her loved ones with her work and efforts.

loans.use: to improve her fruit and vegetable stand.

loans.name: Gita Rani

texts.en:
Gita is 32 years, married and a housewife. She is illiterate, but can sign her name only. She is blessed with three daughters. Two of them are studying in school, and another is below school-going age. She lives with her family in a remote region of Falakata in Alipurduar district in their own small house.

Gita's husband Gopal is a farmer by profession. He mainly has been growing seasonal vegetables like potatoes, gourds, ladies fingers, beans, etc. for the last five years. He has attained a good number of customers. Now he wants to grow his agribusiness by cultivating eggplant on his farmland because it has a huge demand in their locality for its nutritional benefits, but they lack capital to invest in their business.

Thus, Gita is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies like eggplant seeds, pesticide, fertilizer, etc. to grow eggplant. They hope they will get a good harvest for sale. Gita’s great desire is to purchase farmland with the profit in the future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm inputs for eggplant cultivation.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo “kuña Aty”  está en su ciclo número 1º , es un grupo nuevo que va mejorando su situación de pobreza,  a través de las capacitaciones y de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Anastacia es la presidenta del grupo ella se desempeña como comerciante en su casa ,vende bebidas en general   y se describe como una mujer luchadora y capaz para poder salir adelante y necesita el préstamo para poder comprar más bebidas para poder vender y seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que ellos solicitan. Agradecen por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en: The "Kuna Aty" group is in its first cycle. It is a new group who is improving their poverty level through trainings and the survey for elimination of poverty. Mrs. Anastacia is the president of the group. She works selling beverages in her house. She describes herself as a hard working woman capable of getting ahead. She needs a loan to buy more beverages to continue selling and giving her client thay they need. She is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las Divinas está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una de las integrantes lucha por mejorar la vida de su familia a través del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, quieren capacitarse y mejorar los pequeños emprendimientos que hacen cada una.
La señora Marina, ayuda a su familia con una despensa que tiene frente a su casa, tiene todo tipo de productos con los que surte y de esa manera ofrece una buena variedad a sus clientes. Marina es una mujer muy sacrificada, que con esfuerzo y lucha ha podido brindar a sus seres queridos una vida con lo mínimo que necesitan.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas, carne, pollo, embutidos, panificados y otros, para poder surtir su negocio, y seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que piden y solicitan.
texts.en:
Las Divinas is in its tenth cycle with the women's committee program. Each one of the members struggles to improve their family life through the program of enterprising women. They want to get training and improve the small businesses that each one of them engages in.

Marina helps her family with a grocery store that she has in front of her house. She stocks it with all types of products. This way she offers a good variety to her customers. Mariana is a self-sacrificing woman. With effort and tenacity she has been able to provide her loved ones with a life that lacks very little.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy drinks, meat, chicken, sausages, baked goods, and other items in order to be able to stock her business and to continue giving her customers everything that they ask for.

loans.use: to buy drinks, milk, chicken, sausages, baked goods, and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Marienses Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Marienses es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas demuestran unidad y solidaridad entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades variadas, cada una quiere luchar por dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna.
La Sra. María integra este grupo, ella se dedica a hacer manualidades para después poder venderlas, hace todo tipo de manualidades que vende sobre pedidos y también de manera ambulante. Ella se describe como una persona que quiere capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, agujas y otros, para poder seguir haciendo sus manualidades y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: The Marienses Group from San Ignacio, has demonstrated unity and solidarity among them. They work together in diverse activities, and each of them want to work hard to give their loved ones a dignified life. Mrs. Maria is a member of this group, she works making handicrafts which she sells by order and on the street. She describes herself as a person who wants to train and improve her life condition to help her family. She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics, threads, elastics, needles and other items to continue making her handicrafts and continue with her sales.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads, elastics, needles and other inputs to make handicrafts.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, son personas sacrificadas que están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria; quien a través de la venta de verduras está mejorando y ayuda a su familia y sus seres queridos. Es una mujer muy luchadora que con esfuerzo se ha abierto camino y se gana la vida de una manera honesta.
La Sra. Maria solicita de este préstamo para la compra de los productos para la venta, como por ejemplo lechugas, acelgas, cebollitas, mandioca. Maneja bien su negocio para que de esa manera también pueda tener mejores  ingresos.
texts.en: San Miguel is in its 8th cycle of the program of women's committee, where all of them work and help each other get ahead. They are struggling women who form part of the survey for the elimination of poverty. One of their members is Mrs. Maria who is improving her life and her family's life through the sale of vegetables. She is a very hard working woman who, with her efforts,  has opened the way and makes an honest living. She is asking for a loan to buy products to sell such as lettuce, chard, small onions, cassava root. She manages her business well, this way she is able to get better earnings.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell, such as lettuce, chard, small onions, cassava ruta, and others.

loans.name: Suory's Group

texts.en: Suory’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Suory makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and teacher to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.	.

loans.name: Moun's Group

texts.en: Moun’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Moun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 34-years-old married man who lives in Khan Younis. He is a father for two sons and one daughter. Eyad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Eyad decided to start a new business which is transferring goods using a rickshaw.

Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve the family living conditions.
Eyad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Ortencia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (DOMINGA, LILIAN y PILAR) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos y bastimentos; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente 3 años para acceder a préstamo en Pana Pana. 

Dominga: Es integrante del Grupo Solidario, es una señora luchadora, jovial de 35 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo de 11 años de edad que estudia su sexto grado de primaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijo y contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 5 años vende bastimentos y gracias a los créditos otorgados por PANA PANA le han permito adquirir un tramo en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para diversificar su negocio y comprar productos básicos, chiverías, verduras y frijoles, para vender frijoles cocidos. Ella sueña en mejorar la infraestructura de su tramo.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women (DOMINGA, LILIAN y PILAR). They are Miskitas and come from the city of Bilwi, a municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women and work day to day, determined to grow their small businesses selling shellfish and side dishes. They organized as a solidarity group three years ago to have access to a Pana Pana loan.

Dominga is a member of the solidarity group and is a fighter.  She is a jovial, 35-year-old and single mother of an 11-year-old son who is in the 6th grade. With the goal of bringing up her son and being able to have her own source of income, she began selling side dishes five years ago and thanks to the Pana Pana loans she was able to acquire a space in one of the markets in the city of Bilwi. 

She is asking for financing so that she can diversify her business and buy basic products such as dairy products, vegetables and beans to sell cooked beans. She dreams of improving the structure of her market space.

loans.use: to diversify her business and buy basic products such as dairy products, vegetables and beans.

loans.name: Kabir

texts.en: Kabir is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwanki Village. Kabir joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Kabir will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Kabir now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Diodora

texts.en:
Diodora runs a sari-sari( variety) store. She sells basic commodities like coffee, sugar, biscuits, seasonings, canned goods, shampoo, baby diapers, fabric conditioner and many others. She is a 49 years old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 21 and the youngest is 12.
She has been running her sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years.
Her husband has an income by being a tourist driver.

She has requested a loan to buy 5 sacks of rice, feeds, soft drinks, canned goods and beauty products. These will fill the contents of her store and able to attract more buyers to come. Thus, her income will slowly improve and she could start handling her finances wisely.

In the future, Diodora would like to expand her business to be financially stable and sustainable as well.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of rice, feeds, soft drinks,canned goods and beauty products.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 60 years old widow. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of sewing. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring to help run her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She has now requested for a loan of 50000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing more dresses on time. This will mean a boost in her earnings and she wishes to spend it on providing quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La Sra. Elva es propietaria de despensa se dedica la venta de productos de consumo masivo, carnes de todo tipo, chorizos caseros fabricados por ella misma y artículos de bazar en general, tiene todo tipo de productos para la venta. 
Se inició en sus ventas, hace más de 10  años, con una pequeña despensa, actualmente su negocio cuenta con clientela formada, todas las comodidades y muy buena ubicación.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su local con todo tipo de productos para la venta, como ser bebidas, artículos de consumos en general, artículos de bazar y otros.
texts.en: Ms. Elva is the owner of a grocery store. She sells consumer products, all types of meat, home-made chorizo and general homeware. She has a great variety of products for sale. She started the business more than 10 years ago with a small grocery store. Now, she has regular customers, all the amenities and a very good location. She is requesting this loan so that she can stock her store with all types of products to sell, such as refreshments, general consumer products, homeware and others.

loans.use: to buy refreshments, general consumer products, homeware and others in order to sell them.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a Syrian refugee, single and living with his parents and 2 brothers in a rented apartment in the Syrian camp located in the north of Lebanon.

He is 23 years old, and he owns a chicken shop in the area. Mohamad is an ambitious guy and looking to improve his work and situation by asking for 3,000,000 Lebanese pound loan for the first time from Kiva's partner Ibdaa.

Mohammad needs that loan to buy two refrigerators to preserve the quality of the chickens and renovate the decor of his shop. He believes that by changing the decor he will attract more clients and customers and by investing in the refrigerators he will increase his sales and profits and ensure his business' financial sustainability.

Mohamad has experience in the chicken preparation business and has a very good reputation. His prices are competitive in the area. He is very friendly with his clients and very clean while working.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators to ensure healthy and sanitary conditons in his chicken shop and also to redecorate the premises.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwani Village. Daniel joined Babban Gona to expand his  farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Daniel will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Daniel now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Binodini

texts.en:
Binodini is from a small village of Falakata of Alipurduar district in West Bengal, India. She is a homemaker of 46 years. Her husband Nepal is 47 years old. They both are illiterate but can sign their names only. They are blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is a daily laborer, and her daughter got married.

Binodini's husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop that is profitable and is an all-season crop. So, they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. For having inadequate capital, they have decided to take some financial help for cultivation.

Binodini has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), and the requested loan is very important for Binodini. She will purchase the farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers and bear the operational cost for paddy cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize cultivation work, and they hope for a good harvest. They hope it will be a lucrative business, as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. She dreams to expand their agribusiness.

She thanks her lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for growing paddies.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 41 years old, is married and he works as a taxi driver. This time he needs a loan to change the tires on his vehicle. Juan's family is OK. His son is studying at a military school and the other one is going to school. Juan's wife is unemployed so that is why he needs your help again.

Juan would like to buy a house for his family in the future

loans.use: to change the tires on his vehicle .

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be slow paying locals.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of firewood. She hopes that in the future, she will achieve her goals. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy assorted clothes to sell, such as T-shirts, shirts, blouses and trousers.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a married man. He has 5 children. He operates a farm where he grows rice. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and pay labor costs

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ignacia tiene 35 años es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, es comerciante hace mas de 7 años en su domicilio cuenta con una Despensa y Carnicería.
La señora Ignacia tiempo atrás tuvo que salir del país para poder buscar un mejor porvenir, y con lo que pudo tener monto su negocio. Su mayor deseo es que su negocio crezca cada día y mas adelante poder abrir otra sucursal.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar una heladera comercial para poder tener un mejor articulo para poder usarlo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Ignacia is 35 years old. She is a very hard-working and responsible person. She is a businesswoman and for more than 7 years, she has been running a grocery store and a butcher's shop out of her home.

A while ago, Ms. Ignacia had to leave the country to find a better livelihood, and with what she was able to obtain, she started her business. Her wish is for her business to grow every day and to be be able to open a second store.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy a commercial freezer to use in her store.

loans.use: to buy a commercial freezer.

loans.name: Melsita

texts.en:
Melsita works hard to support her family. Melsita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Melsita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Melsita has been in this business for 4 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Melsita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sibaguru Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Pratima, 29, is the one standing to the left in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Odisha, India. She is a good mother, enterprising, active, consistent, responsible, and very hardworking. She has four daughters in her care. The two oldest study at school, and the other two are not yet of school age.

She runs a food stall where she sells tasty food items like idli, vada, dosa, upma, chicken curry, and beverages. The advantage of her business is that her food sells out completely; her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a refrigerator to store her food. Her dream is to open a regular sales stand so she can quit selling itinerantly. She wants to make the purchase of a fridge to store meat and other foods she uses in her business.

For these reasons, Pratima is requesting a loan of 36,000 INR to buy a fridge to store meat and other foods she uses in her business.

loans.use: to buy a fridge to store meat and other foods she uses in her business.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 51 years old married woman. She lives with her husband and pensioner grandmother in Zugdidi district. Nino's husband has a minibus and they decided to trade seasonal fruits and vegetables. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan.

With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of seasonal fruits and vegetables, her husband will be a driver and they both will sell products from village to village. This will increase family income and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Nino is very motivated to have a stable and successful business and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a Babban Gona farmer from Gwani Vilage. Amos joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Amos will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Amos would like to use his extra earnings to build a house/ renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up with seven siblings in a remote village in Rwanda. Due to his impressive academic record and high test scores, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Jean Pierre chose to attend Kepler because he wants to have the opportunity to pursue an international degree. His plan is to study Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduation, he would like to work at a medical NGO, such as the World Health Organization. 

Beyond his career, Jean Pierre would like to establish a fund to assist vulnerable young people with their educations.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 64 years old from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is a widow who works hard so that she can support herself. She buys and sells bananas to earn a living. She is asking a loan so she can increase her banana and earn a better income. Elvira dreamed of seeing her business thrive so that she will remain independent and would not rely on her children for her needs. In the future, she plan to include other fruits to sell as her planned expansion.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Urugero Sub Group A

texts.en:
Liberathe is a group leader; aged 34 years.She is married with 5 children aged between 4 and 10 years. They all go to school. The group is called URUGERO means “EXAMPLE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

Liberathe sells beer and has been running a business for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Sibaguru Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Rina is 30 years old, partnered, with three dependent children. She is the one standing to the right side in the photograph. She lives in her own house with her partner and their children in a small village of Odisha, India. Her husband is a farmer and works very hard for his family.

The work Rina does is in sales. She has a grocery store, which she runs in her home, and sells different items like flour, biscuits, chips, pickles, jams, beverages, etc. She has good personal and work references in her village.

Rina, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. The loan will be used for working capital for merchandise to expand her stock. In this way, she will increase her sales volume and will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to expand her stock so as to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital to expand her business.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be a supplier of cereals to other retailers within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Idris

texts.en: Idris is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kunkun Village. Idris joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Idris suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Idris will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Idris now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is 28, married to driver and has a son and a daughter. Because her husband does not have a constant income, Rasha decided to start a small grocery store project to help him with the family income.

She is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy some grocery products such as oil, pasta, lentil and rice. She believes the profit from the project would help her afford her children's education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products such as oil, pasta, lentil and rice.

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya is a resident of Wolkhu, Lalitpur and lives with her husband, two sons and a daughter. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business. Mrs. Maiya makes a kind of snack speciality that Nepalese youth like to eat. It is a kind of sour snack made up of fruit and spices. She sells her product in grocery shops.

She wants to buy more raw materials for the preparation of these snacks. As she has a good experience in this business, her snack items are very popular among the people.

loans.use: to buy food ingedients for her snack business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a restaurant, which she has been involved in for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to open a hotel within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bernadeth is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Bernadeth has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Bernadeth requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Bernadeth has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Bernadeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en:
Aleksi is 51 years old. He lives in Lanchkhuti district with his pensioner mother. Aleksi has been working in Moscow where he was making wooden furniture and is very experienced in this field. He decided to start his own business in Lanchkhuti.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2000 USD. With the received credit he will purchase all the needed equipment to make wood furniture and sell it. Aleksi hopes that the business will be profitable and he will have a good number of satisfied clients. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to make wooden furniture to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Madaki Village. Ali  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Ali  suffered from poor yields that crippled hisability to purchase better inputs to improve my yield. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Ali  has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 35 bags of maize this year, Ali  can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Elouina

texts.en:
Elouina is a 41-year-old woman from the community of Getafe, Bohol. She owned a sari-sari store business for four years now. With her income, she support her thirteen years old child.

Elouina is requesting a loan to buy side car to start a tricyle business, piglets for hog raising, seasoning, toiletries and condiments. She hope that with the loan from CEVI her plans will materialize and will help bring in more profits for her to save for the future and her family. Her income will be used to buy food, save and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle side car, piglets, seasoning, toiletries and condiments.

loans.name: Metrine

texts.en:
Metrine is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be dedicated. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big grain store within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and expand business.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Ma. Nynah

texts.en:
Ma. Nynah is 45 years old, married with four children.

Ma. Nynah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Nynah has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ma. Nynah aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada is 21 years old, married to a driver and has one son. She and her husband thought of starting a small gas station project, since there are no gas stations in their village. They started the project and Ghada is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy car oils to expand the project and to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy car oils for her gas station

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
O Senhor Armando Sérgio vive na casa própria com sua esposa e duas filhas sendo uma recém nascida. Ele é trabalhador e com o presente empréstimo ele pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente (cimento, areia e pedra), para dar continuidade com a sua obra que já está numa fase bem avançada. 
O seu maior sonho é terminar com a obra, mobiliar e sonha tambem em dar continuidade com seus estudos para conseguir dar vida melhor a sua familia.
texts.en:
Armando Sérgio lives with his wife and two daughters in a house that he owns. One of his daughters is a newborn. He's in the workforce and with the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (namely cement, sand and rocks). That way he'll continue the construction work which is already in an advanced stage.
His biggest dream is to finish the construction work and finish the house. He also dreams of moving forward with his studies so he can provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and rocks.

loans.name: Julia

texts.pt: A dona Julia é uma mulher viuva a mais de 7 anos é mae de 2 filhos maiores de idade e independentes, cuida de 3 netos  onde somente 2 é que vão a escola,com a morte do seu marido a senhora Julia viu se obrigada a ter que aprender a cuidar de si mesma e ajudar os filhos na sua formação profissional.Em casa tem uma pequena mercearia onde vende diversos produtos alimentares,mas sempre sentiu necessidade de fazer crescer o seu negocio,foi então que teve que recorrer a um emprestimo na Hluvuku.Esta é a terceira vez que benefecia se do emprestimo onde pretende comprar produtos alimentares para o seu negocio como açucar,arroz,refrescos,cerveja e sabão,conta que o seu maior sonho é ter um estabelecimento maior e tornar se uma maior empresaria de sucesso.O seu maior desafio é transporte para fazer compras para a mercearia.
texts.en: Julia has been a widow for over seven years. She has two children who are independent adults. She takes care of two grandchildren, only two of whom are in school. After her husband passed away, Julia felt compelled to learn how to take care of herself and help her children achieve a professional degree. She runs a small grocery store at her home where she sells various foodstuffs. She always felt the need to make her business grow and that's why she had to apply for a loan from Hluvuku. This is the third time that Julia benefits from a loan and she intends to purchase merchandise for her business such as sugar, rice, refreshments, beer and soap. She reports that her biggest dream is to own a larger store and become a highly successful entrepreneur. Her biggest challenge is getting transportation in order to go shopping for her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, refreshments, beer and soap.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladys tiene 30 años, es soltera y vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa. Actualmente cuenta con clientela formada que siempre va a su negocio a comprar sus productos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compras de bebidas y lácteos, que son los productos que más vende y quiere poder surtirlo para poder ofrecerlo a sus clientes.
Gladys es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para poder mejorar en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys is 30 years old and lives in the city of Caacupé. She works in commerce, having a well-stocked store in her house. She has a regular clientele who always goes to her business to buy her products.

She is requesting the loan to buy drinks and dairy products. These are the products that she sells the most that she wants to stock up on to offer to her clients.

Gladys is a hard-working woman who is trying to be able to improve her small business.

loans.use: to buy drinks and dairy products for sale.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is 32 years old. He is a Palestinian refugee who has been working in agriculture business since 2003.
Fadi is a hard worker who puts so much effort to develop his business in a well managed way.
He is a married father of two children, who works hard with his beloved wife, who works from their house as a hairdresser, to provide them with the necessary standards of living.

Fadi plants several fruits and vegetables, and he is skilled in his domain. Today, Fadi is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy additional fruitful trees (avocado & durian), to increase and diversify his production for a better income.

He is working hard to open his own fruits and vegetables selling shop for an extra income.

loans.use: To buy additional fruitful trees (avocado & durian), to increase and diversify his production for a better income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide needed supplies for her daughter's embroidery work.

loans.name: N19Áisơn1Đhải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huệ is 47 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fruits for 3 years. Huệ lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household inher village.

The main hardship that Huệ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clean fresh fruits to resell.
Before borrowing money from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, Huệ just sold a few fruits because of her limited capital. In 2011, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She used her loans to expand more types of fruits so that the income also increased.

Huệ has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Huệ is the leader of N19ÁiSơn1ĐHải, which consists of 5 members
With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school and to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clean fresh fruits to resell.

loans.name: Friends Of Fishes - N10Tđông05Qnham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chọn is 44 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Chọn lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her household was recognized by local government as poor. The market need is low in this region, moreover the income from this job is unstable because the amount of fish that is caught and the price of fish trading depends on the weather conditions. The main hardship that Chọn faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

In 2013, Chọn joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Chọn has successfully repaid 3 loans to Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Chọn is the leader of N10TĐông05QNham, which consists of 3 members.

With her business profit, Chọn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es casada y también madre, tiene hijos por quienes está luchando y esforzándose para poder darles una vida digna.
Actualmente tiene un local propio donde tiene ventas de accesorios de celulares, cubiertos, electrónica y otros y lleva productos como relojes y otros a otro país para su posterior venta. Se dedica al rubro hace 6 años.
El préstamo lo pide para la compra de accesorios para celulares, cubiertos y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Encarnación. She is married and is a mother. She has children for whom she is struggling and trying her best to be able to give them a good life.

She currently has her own shop where she sells cell phone accessories, covers, electronics and other things. She takes watches and other products to another country for their subsequent sale. She has worked in this field for 6 years.

She is requesting the loan to purchase cell phone accessories, covers and other things, to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve her business venture.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories, covers and other things.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
At the age of 46, Horn is a married woman who is blessed with four children, three of whom depend on her. One of her children is under the age of school while the other two are working for others for a fee for additional income, added to the main source from cassava growing. The crop which was expected to produce good outputs but was threatened by pests.

This is the second time for Horn requesting for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan which was completely paid back was helpful to her, as she could improve the farmland to get more yields. For this new loan, she will use her entire loan to support cassava growing business by paying the paid workers fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her family’s needs and expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to support her cassava growing business by paying the paid workers fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary is a resident in the town of Loon, Bohol. For almost 15 years now, she has been operating a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like sugar, edible oil, canned goods, bar soap, powdered milk, various soft drinks and toiletries. She is 52 year old married woman with two grown children.
Her husband has also an income that could help defray the family's daily expenses.


She has requested a loan  in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy supplies like rice, soft drinks and assorted dry goods . These will help maintain the stocks of her store and could attract buyers to shop. With these, she could roll-out her capital and able to pay her obligations.  

In the future, Rose Mary would like to improve her sari-sari (variety) store business to be sustainable.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, soft drinks and assorted dry goods

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.en: Jackeline is 35 years old. She is married with four children ages four to fifteen. She and her husband persevere so they can provide for their children. He drive a tricycle for a living and they help each other with farming too. In addition to this, Jackeline sells firewood. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Success in farming is also attributed to fertilizer on the crops. Jackeline hopes to improve the living conditions of her family through her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 31 years old from Getafe, Bohol. She is a mother to three children. Her eldest is 12 and the youngest is 7.

Liza is farming rice while her husband is doing a fishing business to provide for them. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for the motorcycle that she took on an installment payment basis. Liza plans to start a sari-sari (convenience) store business someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for the motorcycle

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
A 45 years old hardworking Palestinian refugee, Samer is a married father of five children, whom he works hard to provide them with the necessary daily needs.
Living in a Palestinian camp is hard for some of the refugees, since it limits their work access to several working sectors.

Samer works in transportation, he provides this services for two years, after a long experience of driving a truck as an employee. Samer is just like any father who seeks perfection for his children, his decision towards starting his own business was to develop his family's living.

Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for the requested construction needs to continue building his house.
He hopes that in the future he can stay capable of developing his family's living and increasing his income.

loans.use: to pay for the requested construction needs to continue building his house.

loans.name: Sari Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The Sari Rahayu group paid off its previous loan on time. During the last six months, the group succeeded in maintaining its pigs. As well as being advised by the Field Officer, they were also visited regularly by the vet. That way the pigs can grow well. The group was a little bit disappointed because the price for pigs is really low this month in their area. This month most of the breeders sold their pigs, which made the price low. But they keep up their spirits and continue to manage the business.

Ni Made, as the leader, is responsible for the group and the repayment. She maintained three fattening pigs which were sold. Although this period she hasn’t earned a satisfactory profit, she still continues the business, with the full support of her husband, and she looks forward to another loan from MUK.

This is the sixth loan for the Sari Rahayu group. They took out a new loan to continue the business. Although during the last period their pigs didn't sell for a good price, they hope this period will be better. The vet suggested giving more nutritious feed and vitamins. Ni Made needs a new loan to purchase two superior piglets, vitamins and feed. She hope she can earn more profit this time, which will all be used for saving.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets, vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement and sand to cement the floor of his house and finish the walls that are made of adobe.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a rice farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is 36 years old with two children ages nine and fifteen.

Farming has been her source of income for the last two years. Lorna is earning 9,000 PHP every harvest season.

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seedlings and food for her family. In the future, she dreams of having a comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and food

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 55 years old from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with ten grown children. Her husband is a carpenter while she farms rice for an income.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for labor to people who will cultivate her farm. Her income helps her family as well as some people in the community.

In the future, Luz hopes to live in prosperity out of her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a display window case where she can put her snacks to be sold.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es:
José es un hombre con 55 años de edad, junto a su esposa trabaja en una pequeña tienda la cual iniciaron desde hace poco por necesidad económica.
Su deseo de salir adelante es admirable porque pese a su avanzada edad no disminuye el esfuerzo por lograr cumplir su sueño, comprar su vivienda propia.

José se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual abastecerá su tienda de productos de aseo personal y de la canasta familiar como el arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles y otros.

Con su aporte este hombre podrá salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
José is a 55-year-old man who, with his wife, works in a small store which they began recently due to economic necessity.

His desire to get ahead is admirable because despite his older age he doesn't reduce the effort to manage to achieve his dream, to purchase his own house.

José is asking for a loan with which he will stock his store with personal care products and pantry items such as rice, sugar, oil, beans and more.

With your contribution, this man will be able to get ahead and achieve his dreams, come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products and pantry items such as rice, sugar, oil, beans and others.

loans.name: Phearoth's Group

texts.en: Phearoth’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Phearoth makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Thavy, 22, is single and lives in Banteay Meanchey province. To make a living, she has been growing rice for the main source of income for two years. This is the first time for her requesting a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).

Thavy will use her loan to pay her school fees for her studying, majoring in Finance and Accounting. Her hope is to get a good paid job after absorbing great knowledge from the university.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees in Finance and Accounting

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to spend on some boxes of vegetables.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 50 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijas de 20, 16, 12, y 7 años de edad  y un hijo de 9 años de edad su vivienda es propia él se esfuerza mucho por darle lo mejor a sus hijos su esposa le ayuda también con lo que puede le ayuda para llevar ingresos a su hogar vendiendo verduras. Él está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en cemento, arena, block, hierro, grava, y mano de obra para construir un cuarto dormitorio para dos de sus hijas mayores, para que ellas tengan un espacio propio en su hogar. El espera la aprobación de su crédito.
texts.en: Juan, 50 years old, lives with his wife and their 4 daughters, ages 20, 16, 12 and 7 and a son, 9 years old. Their house is their own and he works a lot to be able to give his children the best. His wife also helps with what she can. She helps to bring income into the household by selling vegetables. He is asking FUSAI fro a loan to invest it in cement, sand, concrete block, rebar, gravel, and pay labor costs to build a bedroom for two of his older daughters so that they have their own space in the home. He hopes for the approval of the loan.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, concrete blocks, rebar, gravel and pay labor costs to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is a sari-sari store owner. She is 28 years old from Baybay, Leyte. She has three years old son to nurture. With this, to upturn his livelihood Michelle is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, laundry soap, chips, biscuits, candies, spices, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink. In the future, she dreams to improve her business to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, laundry soap, chips, biscuits, candies, spices, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 13, 7 y 14 años de edad su vivienda es propia. Es una mujer muy trabajadora  y luchadora siempre le ha ayudado a su esposo en el aporte económico del hogar. Ella es empleada de una empresa que se encuentra  cerca de su municipio siempre se ha esforzado junto a su esposo por darle lo mejor a sus hijos a quienes aman mucho. Ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para tramitar los papeles legales y las escrituras del terreno donde vive pues ella lo que quiere es dejarles un lugar seguro donde vivir a sus hijos, espera la aprobación del crédito lo más pronto posible para realizar los trámites lo más antes posible y de esta manera tener la alegría de contar con un lugar propio en el cual vivir.
texts.en: María, 41 years old, lives with her husband and three children, ages 13, 7 and 4. Her house is her own. She is a very hard-working and determined woman who always has supported her husband with the economic contributions to the household. She is employed at a business which is near her municipality. She has always worked hard with her husband to give their children, who they love a lot, the best.  She is asking FUSAI for a loan to process the legal papers and registration of the land where they live because she wants to leave her children a secure place to live. She hopes for the approval of the loan as soon as possible to process the paperwork as soon as possible and, in this way, have the joy of having her own place in which to live.

loans.use: to process the legal papers and registration of the land where she lives to have the joy of having her own place to live.

loans.name: Urugero Sub Group B

texts.en:
URUGERO is a group led by Marie who is 37 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 4 and 7 years. The group name means “EXAMPLE” in English. She has been a group leader for 2 years.

She sells clothes and has been selling in her business for 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and dresses for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo runs an eatery. He prepares and sells meals like vegetable stew, fried chicken, fish and pork soup, and other native Filipino meals. He earns three thousand pesos a month from his business.

Eduardo resides in Loon, Bohol. He is a 48 year old man with no dependents. He has been running an eatery for four years now. He needs additional funds to improve his small earnings.

He has requested a loan to buy supplies like vegetables, pork, chicken, and spices. These will cause him to improve his earnings and enable him to pay his bills.

With these, he could start to expand and be able to venture other possible business opportunities.

He is grateful for the loan and he is determined to improve his livelihood to be productive in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies like vegetables, pork, chicken, and spices.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en: Umaru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kaza Village. Umaru joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Umaru suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to provide healthcare for his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Umaru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Umaru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Oumnamkhong Group

texts.en:
Mern is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Mern and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.

The water filter Mern and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Mern and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And, after totaling up the costs, Mern and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Licinia Maria

texts.es:
Licinia es una señora con 46 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hombres con 7 y 22 años, los cuales adora con toda su alma.
Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado, un negocio que inicio alrededor de tres años, y del cual se generan los ingresos necesarios para sostener a sus hijos.
Trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas diarias.

Trabaja con un propósito, el de poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que el estado de esta no es el mejor.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara cerdas de cría, esto lo hace con el fin de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar su utilidad.

Para esto cuenta con la ayuda y el apoyo de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Licinia is a 46-year-old woman, a single mother of two men ages 7 and 22, who she adores with all her soul.

She works raising and selling livestock, a business she began around three years ago, and from which she generates the income needed to support her children.

She works every day for 5 hours daily.

She works with one purpose, which is to pay for her sons' education and improve the conditions of their house, since its condition is not the best.

Currently, she is asking for a loan with which she will purchase pigs to raise. This she will do with the end of improving her sales, increasing her customers and boosting her profits.

For this, she has the help and support of Interactuar and the contributors from the Kiva platform.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Joife

texts.en:
Joife is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a 50-year-old married woman with three children. Of these three children, two are still attending school.

Joife and her partner own a cellphone repair shop where her partner is the technician. They also sell cellphones and accessories like batteries, chargers, casing, head sets, and memory cards. They have been engaged in this business for more than 20 years.

Joife is asking for a loan to buy cellphones and accessories to sell. In the future, she wants to improve her business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Superación Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Superación
Glenda es casada, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 19, 22 años de edad, inicio su negocio hace 8 años, se dedica a la venta de helados en un colegio cercano a su comunidad, y como actividad principal elabora y confecciona ropa especialmente para damas es cuarto crédito que trabaja en fape y le gusta mucho la forma de pago y la atención brindada,  solicita el crédito para la compra de mas telas para tener variación de colores para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en: The "Grupo Solidario Superación" group: Glenda is married and has three children aged 15, 19 and 22 years old. She started her business eight years ago. She works selling ice-cream in a school close to her community and her main business is designing and sewing clothing, especially for women. This is the 4th loan she has had with FAPE and she like the ease of payment and the attention provided her. She is requesting a loan to buy more fabric to have a variety of colors to make her clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El señor Teodoro de 66 años de edad, es casado vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de leña, sus clientes son las personas que se dedican al negocio de la venta de tortillas, los cuales le prefieren por su amabilidad y puntualidad.
Don Teodoro es un hombre  trabajador con muchos deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de leña de carbón, con el apoyo del 
Su sueño es surtir más su negocio y un día mejorar mas su vivienda.

                  
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2015.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 66 years old, married, lives in a community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras, and has worked for 3 years in his business selling firewood. His customers are the people who work at the business of selling tortillas, who prefer him for his friendliness and punctuality.

Teodoro is a hard-working man with a lot of desire to get ahead. He is asking for the loan to purchase firewood and charcoal with the support of Prisma Honduras.

His dream is to stock his business more and one day improve his house more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for his business.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 35-year-old woman, living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother. She wants to build up some savings so that she can provide better living conditions for her family, but it seems unlikely without a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving auto rickshaws for many years, and his income is barely sufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw, but he does not have sufficient funds to make repairs.

Therefore, Saima has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to fix the rickshaw.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband fix his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Sibaguru Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Bimala, 33, standing to the left in the photo, is a hard-working woman who is well-liked in her community. She works in commerce and her source of income comes from her business which is the sale of general groceries and dairy products. She does this work from her home which is located in a strategic area in her community. She has a small and contented family, comprised of her husband and one son.

Bimala gets up very early to attend to her customers who are mostly made up of employees of the factories in the area. Along with her group member, she, is seeking a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Bimala will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase products such as: refreshments, sugar, butter, soap, rice, pasta, cheese, etc., to supply her business and thereby be able to improve her quality of life, and that of her family.
