Alba works raising and selling birds, but currently does not have good working capital. That’s why she finds herself applying for a loan which she will invest in buying chickens, their food, and repairing their coop.

It helps this woman with thousands of dreams to fulfill, so go ahead and give her a loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens, their food, and to repair their coop.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca was married and now she is 40 years old. She started her business in 2011 with her own working capital.

Her business is very small, so she decided to request a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She has planned to expand her kiosk into a bigger store but her capital is not enough, so she is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business.

She will use this loan to buy more items such as rice, cooking oils, soaps, sugar, noodles, salts, biscuits, crackers, eggs and other things to sell. She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oils, soaps, sugar, noodles, salts, biscuits, crackers, eggs and other things to sell.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PRIMAVERA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carolina ella es soltera y tiene 40 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de farmacia.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members make up the Primavera communal bank . This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 
The member Carolina is single and is 40 years old. She works in the grocery store business. She sells basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She wants to get ahead through her business. She is a entrepreneurial and hardworking woman. 
Her dream is to expand the business of her grocery store. Carolina is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.
The other members earn a living selling clothes, in internet sales, in a grocery store and in a pharmacy. 
Carolina is grateful to those who form part to this dream through this loan and promises to make her payments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Golondrinas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario golondrinas es conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras de éxito, es coordinado por Yamilleth de 39 años de edad, casada y propietaria de una pulpería desde hace nueve años donde oferta una amplia variedad de productos a sus clientes, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda a despachar y atender con amabilidad a los clientes. Este es el crédito número 14 que solicita en la institución para la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar, pan y jugos, con créditos anteriores logro hacer unas mejoras en su casa. Yamileth tiene una meta a largo plazo la cual es tener una distribuidora donde pueda vender productos por cantidad, la segunda socia es Rebeca de 42 años propietaria de una pulpería y la tercer socia es Estela de 49 años quien también tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The Golondrinas solidarity group consists of three successful female entrepreneurs, it is led by Yamileth, who is 39 years old, married and for nine years has owned a grocery store where she offers a wide variety of products to her customers.  She also has the support of her husband who helps her to serve and assist the customers in a friendly manner.  This is the 14th loan that she has requested, this is to buy rice, oil, sugar, bread and juices.  With previous loans she made some home improvements.  Yamileth has the long-term goal of having a distributor so she can sell products in bulk.

The second member is Rebeca, who is 42 years old and owns a grocery store, and the third member is Estela, who is 49 years old and also has a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, bread and juices.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cabbages, bananas and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient capital.

This is Pamela's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cabbages, bananas and other vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to be successful within five years.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, bananas and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Wilmer se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, desde hace 3 años, su conyuge le apoya con la ventad de leche fresca y quesos y cría de animales menores, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia, y mejorar de esta forma su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
34-year-old Wilmer lives with his partner and son in the district of Lagunas, a community where people primarily work in agriculture, commerce and cattle raising. His community is in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in Peru's northern coast.

Wilmer has been raising dairy cattle for the past three years. His partner helps selling fresh milk and cheese and raising smaller animals. He has requested a loan to buy feed to fatten his cattle, which will allow him to increase his income and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Ye

texts.en: Ye, 50, is a villager living in Takeo province and married. She has three dependent children, two of whom are in high school and the remaining one who is in university. She grows rice and works as a teacher to earn a living. She has been involved in the rice growing business for 27 years. This is the first time for her to apply for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to pay the school fee for her son. She hopes that this loan will enable her to keep her son in university until he graduates.

loans.use: to pay the school fee for her son.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia Yovana se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los produtos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yovana continues to work in her business selling beauty products. She is a entrepreneurial woman who wants to provide for her family through her business.
Her dream is to have a location where she can sell beauty products. She is requesting the loan to buy creams, lipstick and perfumes. 
Yovana is grateful for the loan and is committed to making the required payments.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipstick and perfumes.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a fish vendor from Maribojoc, Bohol. She buys, and at the same time sells, fresh fish to the community where she lives. She is a married woman with five children. Her youngest child is 19 and still attending school.

She earns 5,000 pesos a month from her fish vending business. Her husband earns a living as a carpenter.

Justina has requested a loan to purchase a variety of fish. This will enable her to improve her income and start to expand her business. Thus, she could continue financing the schooling of her child and provide better living condition as well.

She is determined to work hard for the welfare of her children for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Calleb is 35 years old. He is married and supports four children. He is a hardworking small-scale farmer.

He has applied for his first loan of KES.25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy an additional dairy cow so as to increase his farm's milk production for more income. 

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and improve his family's living standards. He hopes to run a financially stable life.

loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow so as to increase his farm's milk production for more income.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a single woman who describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and mattresses. She has been involved in this business for four years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Las Emprendedoras, ya que ellas son 23 mujeres emprendedoras que luchan por poder mejorar sus vidas, a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres muy sacrificadas y que se esfuerzan para poder salir adelante.
La Sra. Dorca quien integra este grupo, se dedica a la cría y venta de gallinas, es muy humilde y tiene como meta poder ayudar a sus seres queridos en todo lo que tenga a sus alcances y por medio de su humilde trabajo. Ella está esforzándose para poder capacitarse y crecer poco a poco en su emprendimiento.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados y gallinas para la cría. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group is called "Las Emprendedoras" as they are 23 enterprising women who strive to improve their lives through the Poverty Stoplight program. These women are very self-sacrificing and are making an effort to get ahead.

Dorca who is a member of this group, works raising and selling chickens. She is very humble and has a goal of helping her loved ones in any way she can through her humble work. She is making an effort to learn and grow bit by bit with her undertaking.

She is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed and chickens to raise. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide.

loans.name: Melapalapatti Jlg 001 Group

texts.en:
Kavitha works as a daily wage labourer at construction sites. She is married and a mother of a teenaged child. Her work does not pay her enough to sustain her family.

With her monthly earning of Rs. 2000, she cannot hope to secure her child’s future. Therefore, she underwent training to start her own business. She plans to make cushions using coir and sell them so she can earn a better income. She expects her income to double with the start of her new business.

She needs a loan to purchase raw materials to start this business. Kavitha leads a group of five women. She, along with Sasikala, Kumutha, Rani and Rajeswari have applied for a group loan of Rs. 100,000. The loan will help these women start their own businesses and boost their income.

Kavitha and her group are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to start her cushion-making business.

loans.name: Liberta

texts.pt:
A Senhora Liberta vive na casa própria com o esposo e na companhia dos seus dois filhos menores de idade e  sem outros dependentes.  Ela  é comerciante a muitos anos mas sofreu um acidente e teve que ficar um tempo sem exercer a sua actividade, quando melhorou retornou mais precisou de pedir um financiamento para reforçar e assim, recorreu a hluvuku, este e o segundo financiamento. 
Tem uma barraca na sua própria residência e com o presente empréstimo ela pretende comprar produtos para revenda nomeadamente ( ovos, omo, velas, sardinhas, colgate, sabonete e refrigerantes) assim vai reforçar o stock.
O seu maior sonho é expandir o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Liberta lives in a house that she owns with her husband and their two small children without any other dependents. She is a businesswoman and several years ago she had an accident and had to spend some time resting. Once she recovered, she went back to work, but she needed a loan to get back on her feet, so she turned to Hluvuku. Thi is now her second loan.
She set up a booth out of her home and with this loan she wants to buy products to resell such as eggs, laundry detergent, candles, sardines, tooth paste, soap and soft drinks to increase her stock.
Her biggest dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, laundry detergent, candles, sardines, tooth paste, soap and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Geovani Enrique

texts.es: Geovani es un hombre trabajador que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su hermana y su cuñado. Geovani se dedica desde hace varios a prestar sus servicios como auxiliar de albañil, lo que le he permitido salir adelante y sostener la economía de su hogar. Geovani desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, ya que este es de tierra y en invierno esto causa estancamiento de agua lluvia, en la cual se hacen criaderos de mosquitos, por lo que él solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y hierro para encementar el piso de su vivienda y de esta manera evitar criaderos de mosquitos y enfermedades respiratorias.
texts.en: Geovani is a very hardworking man. He lives in his own home along with his sister and his brother-in-law. Geovani  has been working for a few years as a construction worker which has enabled him to get by and take care of living expenses. Geovani wants to cement the floor of his home, since it is a dirt floor which causes water to stagnate there in the winter and is a breeding ground for mosquitos. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and metal to cement the floor of his home and keep mosquitos from breeding, and to avoid respiratory diseases.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and metal to cement the floor of his home and keep mosquitos from breeding.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne is a married woman with four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells electronics and bags. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a sustainable business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 35 years old. She lives in Lahore with her family, including four children as well.

Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He has been using his salon instruments for many years, wearing them out. His instruments need to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments, but his financial condition does not allow him to do so.

Due to his low purchasing power, Shabana requested a loan so that her husband can become empowered and easily buy new instruments such as sissors, combs, shaving machine, front mirror, and revolving chair.

Shabana hopes that this loan will work positively and that she will be able to make some savings for household expenses. Shabana thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy instruments for her husband's barber shop

loans.name: Noemia

texts.pt:
A  Senhora Noémia vive na casa própria com o esposo e dois filhos menores de idade e sem outros dependentes. Ela é funcionária público. Com o presente empréstimo ela pretende adiquirir material de construção para dar continuidade com a sua obra nomeadamente ( cimento, chapas e barrotes).
O seu maior desafio é terminar a construção da sua residência mobiliá-la e a sua maior dificuldade é a falta de meios financeiros. 
O seu maior desejo é adiquirir um meio de transporte que lhe facilite no deslocamento até ao local de trabalho uma vez que reside distante do serviço, no entanto, tem tido faltas devido aos atrasos.
texts.en:
Noémia lives in a house that she owns with her husband and two small children without any other dependents. She is a government employee. She will use this loan to buy construction materials to continue working on her house such as cement, metal sheets and rods.
Her biggest goal is to finish the construction works and furnish the house. Her biggest challenge is her lack of financial means. 
Her hope is to get a vehicle to make is easier for her to get to her workplace as she lives far away from public transportation and she has had to miss work due to transportation delays.

loans.use: to buy cement, metal sheets and rods

loans.name: Oswaldo Arquimedes

texts.es:
Oswaldo, vive con su esposa y una hija menor de edad, se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares, su esposa trabaja de manera independiente, Oswaldo desempeña sus actividades de 8:00 am. a 5:30 pm., su dificultad es la competencia de forma ambulante que existe en el lugar, a pesar de ello ya tiene una cartera de clientes fieles.
Invertirá en la compra de una computadora portátil, le servirá para realizar trabajos a domicilio y generar nuevos ingresos, la finalidad de la inversión es dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener estabilidad económica.
Sus sueños son tener un nuevo negocio y darle a su hija un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Oswaldo lives with his wife and young daughter. He sells and repairs cell phones. His wife works independently. Oswaldo works from 8:00 am to 5:30 pm. It is hard to compete against the street vendors in the area, but despite that, he has a list of loyal customers.

He will invest in buying a laptop computer which he will use to work from home and make more money. The purpose of the investment is to give better service to his customers and have economic stability.

His dream is to have his own business and to provide a better future for his daughter.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer which he will use to work from home and make more money.

loans.name: Rute

texts.pt:
A Senhora Ruti vive na casa própria com seu esposo e seus dois filhos que andam na escola. Ela é comerciante a muito tempo, tinha uma barraca a beira da estrada que fazia muito sucesso, mas com o alargamento da estrada circular fecharam a entrada das viaturas até o seu estabelecimento e assim perdeu muitos clientes e teve que encerrar o seu estabelecimento, mas nem com isso desistiu. Procurou um novo estabelecimento num outro local e conseguiu encontrar na vila de marracuene, uma barraca tipo quiosque onde tem preparado refeições, vende refrigerantes e variedade de bebidas. Com o presente empréstimo vai adquirir produtos da barraca nomeadamente ( frangos, refrigerantes e bebidas) para reforçar o stock.
Seu maior sonho é tornar-se grande empresária, levar avante ou melhor expandir o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Ruti lives in a house that she owns with her husband and two children who go to school. She's been a businesswoman for a long time. She used to have a booth by the side of the road with huge success, but after the widening of the highway, they closed the exit where her booth was located and she lost many customers and was forced to close. But she didn't give up. She found a new location in the village of Marracuene where to set up a stand with meals, sodas and soft drinks. 
She will use this loan to buy products of the stand such as chicken, sodas and soft drinks to stock the business.
Her biggest dream is to become an entrepreneur, to get ahead and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, soft drinks and sodas

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, es viuda, su esposo falleció hace 6 años, con él procrearon 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 están casados y la ultima hija trabaja como empleada domésticos fuera de su casa, pero vive con Gertrudis.

Gertrudis, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 3 años, de los ingresos que ésta le genera, ella sostiene a su familia y trabaja desde su casa; pero además se dedica a la agricultura y paga mozos para que siembren maíz y frijoles.

Gertrudis, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para la milpa y pagar mano de obra y otra parte del préstamo la necesita para pagar los tramites de legalización de un terreno que le pertenece.

El sueño de Gertrudis, es obtener un crédito más grande para construir un cuarto más para su hija y también quiere instalar una granja para obtener ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is 44 years old. She went to school until the fourth grade. She is a widow and her husband died 6 years ago. They had 4 children together. Three of them are married and the youngest daughter is a housekeeper outside of the home, but she lives with Gertrudis.

Gertrudis has had a small store for three years. With the money she makes there, she takes care of her family and works from home. However, she also farms and pays helpers to sow corn and beans.

Gertrudis needs the loan to be able to buy fertilizers for the cornfield and to pay labor costs and another portion of the loan she needs to pay the legal processing fees for a piece of land she owns.

Gertrudis’ dream is to get a larger loan to build an extra room on her house for her daughter. She also wants to set up a farm to be able to make more money.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the cornfield and to pay labor costs and another portion of the loan she needs to pay the legal processing fees for a piece of land she owns.

loans.name: Salomao

texts.pt:
O Senhor Salomao é casado, vive na casa própria com a sua esposa, ele é professor. Com o presente empréstimo ele vai adiquirir material de construção (cimento, ferro e varoes) para dar continuidade com a asua obra. O seu maior sonho é se tornar empresario na area de construção civil visto que ele se formou nesta area.
Tem dificuldades financeiras  para abrir empresa na area de construção civil.
texts.en:
Salomao is married. He lives in a house that he owns with his wife and he is a professor. He will use this loan to buy construction material such as cement, iron beams and rods to continue building his home.
His biggest dream is to work in the construction field as that is his area of expertise.
He has struggled financially to open his own construction company.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron beams and rods

loans.name: Las Artesanas Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Artesanas se encuentran en su ciclo numero 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, el grupo está conformado por 17 mujeres  que luchan cada día por salir adelante, inspiradas por un progreso digno y una mejor calidad de vida de todas ellas, que también como objetivo común tienen superar la pobreza en su totalidad.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Evangelista ella es artesana, elabora hamacas colchas para la venta, gracias  al préstamo quiere poder comprar insumos para hacer sus artesanías, como ser hilos, bastidores, agujas y otros. Evangelista es una persona que se esfuerza para poder mejorar y crecer.
Las integrantes de este grupo están esforzándose por mejorar su calidad de vida, y superarse por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
texts.en:
Las Artesanas Group is in its third loan cycle with the women's bank program. The group is made up of 17 members who strive every day to get ahead, inspired by decent progress and a better quality of life for all of them. Another goal they have in common is to completely overcome their poverty.

Evangelista is one of the members. She's an artisan who makes hammocks and bedspreads to sell. Thanks to the loan she wants to buy thread, frames, needles, and other supplies to make her crafts. She's someone who makes an effort to be able to improve and grow.

The members of this group are making an effort to improve their quality of life and improve themselves through the Poverty Stoplight program.

loans.use: to buy thread, frames, needles, and other supplies to make handicrafts

loans.name: Tania

texts.pt:
A senhora Tania vive na casa própria com seus três filhos e um sobrinho, todos menores de idade e andam na escola, ela é militar o seu esposo trabalha fora da província. Com o presente empréstimo ela  vai adiquirir mercadoria para revenda nos seus tempos livres nomeadamente ( capulanas e tecidos).
O seu maior desejo é estar perto do seu marido, ela so o vê uma vez em cada semestre devido ao custo de transporte e a distância que os separa que é cerca de 2149 km. Seu sonho é terminar a construção da sua residência, construir uma boutique onde possa continuar com o seu negócio e dar o sustento aos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Tania lives in a house that she owns with her three children and a nephew all going to school. She is in the military and her husband works out of the province. She will use this loan to buy merchandize to resell in her spare time such as capulanas and woven textiles.
Her biggest hope to be close to her husband. They only see each other once every semester due to the cost of transportation and the distance that separates them, around 2149 km. Her dream is to finish construction of her home, build a boutique to further her business and support her children.

loans.use: to buy capulanas and woven textiles to sell

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca con una sonrisa en sus labios nos cuenta que inició su negocio con el apoyo de su madre y su abuela, quienes por tradición han elaborado bollos de maíz verde, bollos de angelito y cocadas;  durante su niñez empezó a envolver bollos, decorar cocadas y poco a poco su interés se fue haciendo cada vez mayor, hasta acaparar todo el proceso productivo, interiorizarlo y apropiarlo para su propia microempresa. Hoy sus hijos cuentan emblemáticas historias de su negocio, el cual ha hecho parte fundamental para el crecimiento y bienestar de la familia, en la que su joven madre de 48 años ha trabajado desde que cumplió su mayoría de edad y sus frutos han sido proporcionales a su gran dedicación y esfuerzo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra al por mayor de maíz dulce, queso, coco y panela. Con esta inversión obtendrá descuentos y sus ganancias mayores.  Su meta a futuro es remodelar su vivienda y duplicar las ventas en los próximos seis meses.
texts.en:
Rebeca, smiling, tells us she started her business with her mother's and grandmother's help. Traditionally, they had made bollos de maíz verde, bollos de angelito, and cocadas [traditional foods]. In her childhood, she began wrapping bollos and decorating cocadas. Bit by bit her interest grew stronger until she had learned everything about the production process, internalized it and appropriated it for her own small business.

Today her children tell stories about her business which was a fundamental part of their childhood and their family's well being. Their youthful 48-year-old mother has worked since she was old enough to and the fruits of her labor have been in proportion to her dedication and effort.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in buying wholesale sweet corn, cheese, coconut and raw cane sugar. With this investment she will get discounts and her income will improve. Her goal is to remodel her home and double sales in the next six months.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sweet corn, cheese, coconut and raw cane sugar.

loans.name: Madelin Adriana

texts.es:
Madelin, es dueña de una venta de accesorios para floristería y prendas de vestir, negocio que con ayuda de su esposo ha puesto en marcha, trabaja todos los días y su familia le ayuda a atender a sus clientes, vive con su esposo y tres hijos.
Ha solicitado un crédito para surtir mejor su negocio comprando flores, telas, pegamento y variedad de prendas de vestir,continuara atendiendo dela mejor manera a sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para mantener su fuente de ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Madelin owns a floral accessories and clothing store, a business she started with her husband's help. She works every day and her family helps her wait on her customers. She lives with her husband and three children.

Madelin has requested a loan to better supply her business with a purchase of flowers, fabric, glue, and a variety of garments. She will continue to serve her customers as best she can. She hopes to increase her sales and earn more income.

Her dream is to continue working to keep her source of income and improve her whole family's quality of life.

loans.use: to better supply her store with a purchase of flowers, fabric, glue, and a variety of garments

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa ella es casada y tiene 57 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, galletas y aceites, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Sol y Luna.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Sol y Luna Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Luisa, is 57 years old and married, and she has three children. She works in her grocery store business selling staple products such as rice, sugar, milk, cookies, and oil. She works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. She gets her children ahead with this work. Her dream is to expand her grocery store.

Luisa is requesting the loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She's grateful to those who share her dream through this loan and she promises to make her payments punctually.

The other members earn their livings in a photocopying business, a grocery store, and food sales. The member whose face is covered with a circle is no longer a member of Sol y Luna Communal Bank.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Active Women Do Business - 62Đphạnhlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyện is 21 years old, and she is married and has one child. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for two years. Nguyện lives in Hau Loc district, a rural place in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Nguyện faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise, which she will resell in the future.

Nguyện joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution in 2014, to improve her business. Nguyện has successfully repaid two loans to Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of 62Đphạnhlộc, which consists of four members.

With her business profit, Nguyện hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry, to raise and resell in the future

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops and also keeps cows for milk production. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy a water tank, and gutters to store and harvest clean water for domestic use. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank, and gutters to store and harvest clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, and herbicides to grow corn and squash.

loans.name: Davies

texts.en: Davies is a married man with 2 children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, soda, milk, and cereals. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as price fluctuation. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of cereals and milk. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stocks of cereals and milk

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабира, 51 год, замужем, есть 4 детей. У нее- высшее образование, работает главным бухгалтером в больнице. С 1997 года она занимается также полеводством. На земельном наделе мерой 6,0 ГА, выращивает фасоль, картофель и клевер для реализации. Сабира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 105,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят, и селитры для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистых продуктов. Доходы от кредита позволят Сабире развить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Sabira is 51 and married with four children. She has a higher education and works as head accountant in a hospital. She has also been working in agriculture since 1997. She has 6 hectares of land where she grows beans, potatoes and clover for sale. 

Sabira has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 105,000 KGS to purchase two calves and fertilizer for her soil to help her grow organic produce. Profits from the loan will allow her to develop her business and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy two calves and fertilizer to help her grow organic produce

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 44-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and three sons. Her husband has been manufacturing marble utensils for many years. He is the person responsible for feeding the entire family. He is a specially-trained maker of marble utensils that are used for grinding herbs, spices, etc. He buys raw marble stone pieces and manufactures marble utensils. People in the area like his marble utensil collection a lot. That is the reason his current business is running well and increasing day by day.

He has decided to increase his current business, and needs a lump sum. Therefore, Sughran is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can purchase more stock of raw marble stones for manufacturing utensils.

Sughran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase raw marble for her husband's business making marble utensils

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique tiene 51 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida, él es un hombre muy trabajador, él se dedica al cultivo y venta de hortalizas como rábano, pepino, ayote, güisquil, chile verde etc. Desde hace 20 años gracias a este pequeño negocio es como el obtiene sus ingresos económicos para él y su compañera de vida. Enrique desea comprar más insumos para que sus ganancias sean mayores ya que cuenta con una buena clientela que compran de sus hortalizas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: abono, fertilizantes, alambre nylon, hilos, cal agrícola y semilla para poder tener otra mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Enrique is 51 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner. He is a very hardworking man, and makes a living cultivating and selling vegetables such as radish, cucumber, squash, chayote, and green pepper, etc. He has had this small business for 20 years, and thanks to it he obtains the income he needs for himself and his life partner.

Enrique wishes to buy more supplies so that his earnings increase, as he has a very good clientele pool that purchase his vegetables. It is for this reason that he requests a loan from FUSAI, so that he can invest in: manure, fertilizer, nylon wire, strings, agricultural lime, and seeds, so that he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in: manure, fertilizer, nylon wire, strings, agricultural lime, and seeds, so that he can have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
KETY TIENE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE,TIENE 02 HIJOS DEPENDIENTES, VIVE JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN EL DISTRITO DE PUCARA, PROVINCIA DE JAEN, REGION CAJAMARCA, SIERRA NORTE DE PERU. EN DICHO DISTRITO LA POBLACION SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA SIENDO EL CULTIVO DE ARROZ SIENDO ESTE EL DE MAYOR PRODUCCION, ASI COMO AL COMERCIO EN GENERAL.

KETY SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DE HELADOS , GELATINAS, FLAN , TORTA HELADA, ETC, LOS CUALES VENDE EN SU DOMICILIO Y A LAS AFUERAS DEL COLEGIO DE PUCARA CUENTA CON MAS DE 05 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, CON MUY BUENAS REFRENCIAS PERSONALES, SOLVENCIA MORAL Y ECONOMICA. EL PRESTAMO TIENE COMO DESTINO LA INVERSION EN SU NEGOCIO PARA LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS Y MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS PRODUCTOS Y SU POSTERIOR VENTA Y PODER ADQUIRIR UNA UTILIDAD ACEPTALE PARA QUE MEJORE SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Ketty is 43 years old, is in a relationship, and has 2 dependent children. She lives with her family in the district of Pucara, in the province of Jaen in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. In this district, the people are dedicated to agriculture, especially to growing rice. Rice is most of the production and most of the overall business.

Ketty is dedicated to making and selling ice cream, gelatin, flan, ice cream cake, etc. She sells these products from her home and outside the high school in Pucara. She has more than 5 years of experience in this work, and she has very good personal references for her moral and financial solvency.

The loan will be used to buy supplies and raw materials for making her products. This will lead to sales and allow her to earn enough income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials to make her products.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira engages in a buy-and-sell business. She sells fresh fish to the locals in her place. In addition to the fish-vending business, she sells bananas and cassava. She is a 48-year-old, widowed woman, with two dependents, aged 10 and 7 years. She earns three thousand, five hundred pesos out of her fish-vending business.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like fish, bananas, and cassava. With these, she could be able to sell a greater variety of fish and improve her daily earnings. Thus, she could provide her children with healthy diets. She could also settle her finances and start to expand her business.

In the future, Elvira dreams of purchasing a new tricycle, which would be very helpful in transporting her goods for her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fish, bananas, and cassava.

loans.name: Cecilia Yamileth

texts.es:
Cecilia es una persona hogareña, vive con sus padres y hermanos, se dedica a tender su propio negocio de venta de ropa y otros productos, los ingresos que obtiene los utiliza para subsistir y apoyar a su familia, el oficio lo aprendió de sus amistades, además con apoyo de su madre aprendió a vender comida, tiene más de 4 años de experiencia.
Con el capital podrá realizar la compra de vestidos, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, etc., la finalidad es tener un negocio más fuerte para que sus clientes tengan a su alcance productos que están de moda en el mercado.
La visión de Cecilia es construir su casa propia y mantener el apoyo económico que le da a su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a home-loving person. She lives with her parents and siblings, and she has her own business selling clothing and other products. She uses the income of support herself and her family. She learned the trade from her friends. With the help of her mother, she also learned to sell food. She has more than 4 years of experience.  

With the loan she will be able to buy dresses, pants, shirts, underwear, etc. with the goal of having a stronger business so that her customers will have the latest fashions available to them. Cecilia's dream is to build her own home and to continue to provide the financial support that she gives her family.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, shirts, underwear etc. with the goal of having a stronger business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a 58-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with four adult children. Her husband is a fisherman while Nelly is buying and selling fuel to the community. She has been doing this for three years. In the future, Nelly dreams to improve their livelihood. She wants to have better earnings to save money for the future. With this, she is asking a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fuel to sell.

loans.use: to buy fuel

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a 30-year-old woman from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and has four children, ages 12, 10, 8, and 2 years old. To earn a living, Beverly and her husband are engaged in various businesses. Her husband is working hard as a farmer and a driver, while Beverly is running a sari-sari store and raising hogs.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed, fertilizer for their crops, and grocery items such as toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink, candies, biscuits, chips, spices, canned goods, noodles, and soft drinks. She only hopes in the future to have her own capital, with which to run her sari-sari store and her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer for their crops, and grocery items such as toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink, candies, biscuits, chips, spices, canned goods, noodles, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is now the age of 33 years, but she also did not lose her competitiveness in business. She has a kiosk and she is also selling children's clothing. Regina opened her business in 2014, with a capital of $200. She has already been running for one year of effort, so now she has an idea to request a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. With this money she wants to buy more goods such as cigarettes, eggs, candies, sugar, noodles, sardines, coffee, shampoo, milk, children's clothing and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, eggs, candies, sugar, noodles, sardines, coffee, shampoo, milk, children's clothing and other things to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Ejemplares Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Ejemplares se llama este grupo, están en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ilse, quien se dedica a vender ropas variadas, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Ilse está poniendo su esfuerzo para poder capacitarse por medio de la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas variadas, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo para poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Ejemplares. They're in their second loan cycle with the women's bank program, in which all the members work and help each other get ahead. They're doing the Poverty Stoplight survey and each of them is putting forth her best effort to be able to improve her living conditions.

One of the members is Ilse, who earns a living selling a variety of clothing. She's a very hardworking and enterprising person who's putting her best effort into being able to help her family with her job and get training with the help of Fundación Paraguaya.

Ilse's requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of clothing. That way she can continue with her job and be able to improve her income and keep helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: seeds, fertilizers, barbed wire, and agave so she can make more sales and meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Ilberto Pablo

texts.es:
Ilberto tiene 57 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su conyuge su 1 hijo de 14 años, viven en el caserio El Arenal del distrito de Santo Tomas, en casa propia de material rustico en una comunidad pequeña, que pertenece a la provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Ilberto es la agricultura, cultiva cafeto, de la variedad catimor sembrando 2 has de su propiedad,su predio se ubica en el Caserio Playa grande del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, se dedica a este rubro hace 3 años, tambien se dedica a cria y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, el destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ilberto is fifty-seven years old and has a permanent home with his spouse and his fourteen year old son. They live in the hamlet of El Arenal in the Santo Tomás district. Their country house is in a small community in Cutervo Province, Cajamarca Region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Ilberto works in agriculture growing coffee trees, the catimor variety. He sows two hectares of his property. His property is located in the large Cesario Playa in the Santo Tomás district in Cutervo. He has worked in this area for three years. He also works raising and selling small animals and everyday grocery items. He has a lot of experience in the area. The loan is destined for maintaining his crop. With it he will get a better yield and a higher income so he is able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Christabel

texts.en: Christabel is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are women. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have a big salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for salon use.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia has sold vegetables since 2010 and requests a loan of $ 1500.00 to improve her business. She will used this loan to buy more vegetables. She started her business with her working capital of $400.00. She will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy tomatoes, tempeh, tofu, fish and other items to sell.

She works everyday and earns a good income from selling vegetables.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, tempeh, tofu, fish and other things to sell.

loans.name: Hernan Dario

texts.es:
Hernán es un señor soltero con 46 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde, dedicado a realizar labores de campo desde muy niño, una actividad que aprendió viendo a sus padres, quienes se dedican a lo mismo.
Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, le pertenece un gran cultivo de café del cual obtiene muy buenos ingresos, los cuales son invertidos en su familia conformada por sus padres y un hermano menor.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de abonos por bultos.

la actividad que realiza este hombre para sobrevivir  con los suyos es digna de aplausos y  es aconsejable prestarle el beneficio de apoyo que solicita.
texts.en:
Hernán is a single man, who is 46 years old. He is hard working and very humble. He has been dedicated to farm work since he was a young boy; it is work that he learned from his parents, who did the same thing.

With this, he has made a lot of progress. He has a large coffee crop, from which he earns a very good income. His income is invested into his family, which includes his parents and a younger brother.

He is requesting a loan to buy packages of manure. This man does his work to survive and is deserving of applause; it is advisable to offer him the support he requests.

loans.use: to buy packages of manure.

loans.name: Thinnakonnam Jlg - 004 Group

texts.en:
Maheswari is a 41-year-old woman with 3 children, who works as a laborer in the Tiruchirappalli district in Tamil Nadu. Her job is seasonal and the pay is inadequate. The income she earns from her current job is not sufficient to sustain her family. Therefore, she needs a loan to start a business of her own. Maheswari underwent training from Gramalaya Microfin Foundation to learn to make foot mats. She expects her business to earn her an additional 1100 RS every month.

Just like Maheswari, the other group members (Kavitha, Rani, Kokila and Anbu Selv)i received training. They have joined Maheswari in applying for a loan to start their respective businesses. Your loan will help boost their income and will help them secure their future.

loans.use: to start her business to make  mats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new taxi for her husband's work

loans.name: Tegal Badeng Indah Group

texts.en:
After working through the six-month loan period, the Tegal Badeng Indah group made their payment on time. During their meeting, they shared their experiences with one another. Finally, four of them have reached their goal with their own businesses. They can sell the pigs for a satisfactory price, and they can earn profit. They made savings, and now they have enough capital to continue their businesses with their own money. They are very grateful and said many thanks to Lenders, Kiva and MUK, for supporting them. Now they can be the example to the remaining five members in the Tegal Badeng Indah group.

Ni Made, as the head, used her previous loan to expand her business, in a small kiosk. Now she has many customers. The Tegal Badeng Indah group decided to take another loan, to expand their businesses in farming, trading, and breeding. Ni Made is using her new loan to expand her small kiosk business. She’s purchasing a lot of merchandise and items needed in daily life, such as rice, oil, soap, vegetables, and school supplies. She hopes she can earn more profit, to increase her savings. Ni Made has two school-aged children, in kindergarten and in elementary school. She dreams and hopes she can support her children's education until university.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and items needed in daily life, such as rice, oil, soap, vegetables, and school supplies.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a thirty-two-year-old man, who is married and has seven children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. His business is cocoa buying and selling, but he also has cocoa gardens. He is a very hard-working man, and he hopes to educate his children. He started his business in 2007 and is steadily moving on well. His challenge is inadequate capital. He wants the loan to buy more cocoa to sell. He used the first loan to buy cocoa to sell as the season was very good.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with2 children. She describes herself tas visionary. She has operated a beauty salon for 6 years. Her primary customers are local people.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages. She will use 30,000 KES to buy beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have several business outlets within 5 years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy beauty products for salon use

loans.name: John Heider

texts.es:
Su deseo de salir adelante es admirable, porque pese a las duras circunstancias por la que ha pasado John no se rinde, lo que se propone lo cumple, una de sus metas era tener su vivienda propia, y lo logro, ahora trabaja con un propósito, el de montar su propio negocio, anhela tener un almacén de ropa.
Actualmente vende ropa desde su casa, pero espera abrir su primer local y formalizar su negocio.
Trabaja todos los días durante 6 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprará camisetas, jeans y ropa interior al por mayor.

Ayuda es este hombre con deseos de salir adelante, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
John Heider's desire to get ahead is admirable, because despite the difficult circumstances he has faced, John does not give up; he finishes whatever he sets out to do.

One of his goals was to have a house of his own, and he accomplished it. Now, he works for another purpose: to start his own business. He yearns to have his own clothes warehouse.

He currently sells clothes from his own house, but hopes to open his first shop and to formalize his business. He works for 6 hours every day.

He is requesting a loan so he can buy shirts, jeans, and underwear at wholesale. Help this man with his wishes to get ahead, help out with a loan.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, and underwear at wholesale.

loans.name: Sibaguru Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Gita is a charismatic woman. She is 31 years old, and is the one standing to the right hand side in the photograph.

Gita thought that she should look for opportunities to support herself after separating from her spouse, a situation that demanded her to change her lifestyle and, so, open new horizons. She began to work among neighbors and people she knew in the area as a babysitter, since her own experience as a mother allowed her to provide comprehensive care to the children who were left in her care. She also alternated this work with her gifts as a good cook, and on the weekends she offers delicious dishes to her neighbors.

Currently Gita, along with her group member, is applying for a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR) .She will use her portion of the loan amount to invest in groceries that she will use in preparing food for the children and to sell the food on the weekends. Gita has had success in her businesses and, with this investment, will offer a better service. Her goal for the future is to grow her business and leave her two children an inheritance.

loans.use: to invest in groceries that she will use in preparing food.

loans.name: Patitapabani Bhinnakshyama Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Binapani is a 29-year-old married lady and lives in a small village of Odisha, India. She is a blessed mother of two children and is standing to the right in the photo. For more than 10 years, Binapani has operated a grocery store in her place to earn a living. She sells various goods like canned food, shampoo, coffee, conditioner, bath soap, detergent, noodles, salt, and vinegar. She also makes dresses for other people for additional income.

Binapani, along with her fellow group member, is asking for a loan of 36,000 India rupee (INR). She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy toothpaste, canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries and detergents, bread and biscuits, cooking oil, condiments, powdered fruit juice, candy, snacks, cloth, and feed. This will help her improve her stock, allowing her to cater to more buyers in her store.

Binapani dreams of living in comfort in the future.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries and detergents, bread and biscuits, cooking oil, condiments, powdered fruit juice, candy, snacks, cloth, and feed.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en: Irum is 33 years old. She is a responsible mother of four children. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of six people. She is well-trained in sewing and provides stitching services to the customers from her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of items including thread, needles, and cloth. She wants to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult.  Irum requests a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.  Irum is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a variety of fabric.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 47-year-old married women. She is mother of two sons and four daughters. She has started a clothing sale business. She wants to support her family through her business. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market. 
Presently she needs to purchase some clothes to sell, however due to lack of finance she is facing problems. Because of that she has requested a loan from Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her own clothing sale business

loans.name: Sibaguru Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Tanaya is 28 years old. She is married and a housewife and is the one standing to the right hand side in the photograph. She is illiterate, so she can sign her name only. She is blessed with two daughters. They live in a remote region of the State Odisha, India in their own mud and straw-made house.

Tanaya's husband is a farmer by profession. He mainly grows vegetables like potatoes, gourds, ladies fingers (okra), beans, etc. He grows quality products, and his prices are also cheaper. So, the numbers of his customers are increasing gradually.

Tanaya, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR). She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy vegetable seeds, pesticide, fertilizer, etc. to grow varieties of vegetables. She will use a part of loan amount to bear the operational cost throughout the year. They hope that with this loan amount, they will have a good harvest. With the profit from this business, they hope they can secure their lives in terms of food, health, and education.

Tanaya dreams to build a concrete house with the profit from their business in the future. She is thankful to Peoples Forum and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, pesticide, fertilizer, etc. to grow varieties of vegetables.

loans.name: Musiri South Jlg - 028 Group

texts.en:
Pushpalatha earns a daily wage as a laborer in the Tiruchirappalli district in Tamil Nadu. Her family idepends on agriculture for sustenance. Pushpalatha has 2 children and she wants to secure the future of her children. She currently earns 2500 RS every month, but she knows that this would not help her save enough for her children’s education.

She decided to find an alternative to her current low paying job. She underwent training to make sweets made from peanuts. Now she wants to start a business of her own to make and sell these sweets. She expects her monthly income to increase by 1300 RS. The only thing holding her back is the shortage of funds. A loan from you can help her start her new business and eventually increase her income.

Pushpalatha leads a group of women who want to start businesses of their own after receiving training. Together, they need a loan of 100,000 RS to start their businesses. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to start her business selling sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El tiene 53 años de edad es casado de ocupación obrero. Hace seis años le diagnosticaron cataratas en el ojo derecho. Quiere recuperar la vista ya que puede llegar a perder su trabajo a consecuencia de este padecimiento. Necesita con  urgencia un implante de lente intraocular todo esto para recuperar al 100% la vista. Desgraciadamente sus ingresos económicos no son muchos, además él es el único sustento de su familia y si llegara a perder su trabajo seria mas difícil poder volver a ver.
texts.en:
He is 53 years old and married, and works as a laborer.

Six years ago he was diagnosed with cataracts in the right eye. He wants to recover his sight because his predicament could cause him to end up losing his job. He urgently needs an intraocular lens implant to fully recover his eyesight.

Unfortunately he doesn't earn much income. Also, he's the only support for his family and it would be more difficult for him to recover his sight if he were to lose his job.

loans.use: to pay for eye treatment

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge tiene 52 años, está casado y tiene hijos, el señor trabaja en obras viales con su  camión tumba, su esposa también trabaja y juntos se ayudan para poder salir adelante.
Jorge pide este préstamo para la compra de cubiertas para el camión tumba ya que quiere poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jorge is 52 years old, and married with children. He works in road construction with his dump truck. His wife also works, and they help each other in order to get ahead.

Jorge is requesting this loan to buy tires for the dump truck so that he can continue to provide good service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy truck tires.

loans.name: Patitapabani Bhinnakshyama Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Sabita is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in a small village of Odisha, India and is the one standing to the left. She is a widow and all her children are grown up and own their own livelihood. Sabita is engaged in cultivating paddy and earns an income that only satisfies her basic needs. She has access to very limited resources and struggles really hard to earn her livelihood.

Therefore Sabita, along with her fellow group member, is requesting for a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR). Sabita will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase high-yielding varieties of seeds and organic manures in order to increase her crop yield and enjoy a better standard of living.

Sabita is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase high-yielding varieties of seeds and organic manures.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en: Nani is from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and has three children, ages 21, 15, and 11 years. Her husband is working abroad to provide for the needs of their family. To help her husband, Nani is running a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for ten years and hoping that someday it will become profitable. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery items, such as chips, biscuits, candies, spices, canned goods, noodles, eggs, coffee, sugar, laundry soap, breakfast cereal, toiletries, soft drinks and liquor. In the future, she dreams her children will finish their studying and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy chips, biscuits, candies, spices, canned goods, noodles, eggs, coffee, sugar, laundry soap, breakfast cereal, toiletries, soft drinks and liquor.

loans.name: Patitapabani Bhinnakshyama Shg-B Group

texts.en:
The lady standing on the left-hand side in the photo is Mina, a member of Patitapabani Bhinnakshyama Shg-B. She is 26 years old, married, and blessed with one child. Her husband works as a taxi driver in a nearby town.

Mina does maize, bean, and potato farming on her small farm. She is grateful for Peoples Forum's training, which has enabled her to manage the enterprise well.

She, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR). Mina will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase farm inputs such as seeds that will help increase yields, resulting in better income to enable her to support basic family needs such as education, Medicare and clothing. She is happy with Kiva and their lenders for their intervention and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds, that will help increase yields.

loans.name: Musiri South Jlg - 030 Group

texts.en:
Latha is a 41-year-old, daily wage labourer. She lives with her family of four, in the Tiruchirappalli district of Tamil Nadu. She currently earns Rs. 4000 every month, but this is not enough to sustain her family. Thus, she decided to start a business of her own.

Latha wants to sell sweets made of peanuts, after undergoing training. She expects her monthly income to increase by Rs. 1200. To start her business, she needs a loan, because the current household income is not enough to fund her business. Latha is joined by four women who also seek a loan to start their respective businesses. Together, the group seeks a loan of Rs. 100,000. Your loan will help these women start their own businesses and contribute more to their families, financially. They are grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to start her sweets-selling business.

loans.name: Temoteo

texts.en: Temoteo is a 51-year-old man from the town of Getafe, Bohol. He is married and has an 18-year-old son. He has been farming rice and raising hogs for quite some time. He also engages in buying and selling of farm animals. He is asking for a loan to buy quality feed and piglets, to expand his business. Temoteo dreams of an abundant life, as a result of his business.

loans.use: to buy quality feed and piglets

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is a fisherman. He lives in Talibon with his wife. His seven children are already adults. He continues to work hard, so that he can support himself and his wife.

He is asking for a loan to buy paint, plywood, and nails. This will help him to maintain his boat and to work efficiently. In the future, he plans to expand his business for increased profits.

loans.use: to buy paint, plywood, and nails.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business, where she sells tomatoes, bananas, peas, onions, oranges, and other vegetables and fruits. She also does dairy farming. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are locals. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of sufficient capital.

She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock, including bananas, tomatoes, oranges, and other vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock, including bananas, tomatoes, oranges, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine, a married mother of one, describes herself as patient. For two years she has been operating a boutique where she sells baby clothes. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

Delphine will use this Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years, something she will put the anticipated profits from this loan toward.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 1-B Group

texts.en:
At just 26, Rina is already juggling her time between raising two young children, ages 5 and 3, and working a part-time job. As if that is not enough, she is now also going into the food business. She is hardworking and focused on giving her children a better life. She is a single mother and is the one standing to the left in the photograph.

Rina, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a Kiva loan of 36,000 India rupees (INR). She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy equipment: a refrigerator, a microwave, and a gas stove, and also to also buy foods. With this loan she will be able to launch a takeaway food business.

"I want my children to have better chances than I did," says a hopeful Rina.

loans.use: to buy equipment: a refrigerator, a microwave, and a gas stove, and also to also buy foods.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, a 47-year-old mother of two daughters and three sons,  lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, thereby preventing him from generating any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

Nasreen has therefore requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son cover the cost of repairs. This will help him to continue his business. Nasreen is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this funding opportunity.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her son's rickshaw

loans.name: Marjurie

texts.en:
Marjurie is a 29-year-old farmer from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is a mother of three children, ages one, seven, and ten years.

Marjurie is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm, to make her crops grow disease-free. She could then help her husband, who is working as a carpenter, to earn a living and provide better for their family’s needs. In the future, she plans to increase her business's sustainability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 1-A Group

texts.en:
Ksheer, 55, is the one standing to the left in the photo. She hails from a small and remote village of Odisha, India.

Despite being a widow, going through many bad times in her life, and raising 5 children on her own, Ksheer has not given up her dream of improving her quality of life and being a businesswoman. Her strong patience and perseverance never let her lose hope. She is currently engaged in poultry farming and earns her livelihood from this source only.

Ksheer, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR). Ksheer will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more baby chickens and feeds for them. She dreams of starting her dairy business simultaneously with her poultry farming business and enhance her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more baby chickens and feeds for them.

loans.name: Patitapabani Bhinnakshyama Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Chandrakanti is married with four children. She is the one standing to the left-hand side in the photograph. She lives in a small and remote village in Odisha, India. She has faced challenges in life, such as the death of her parents and inadequate finances to start up a business of her own. Her husband is a carpenter by profession, and Chandrakanti is a farmer by profession.

Chandrakanti, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 India rupees (INR). With this new loan she will buy manure, fertilizer, fungicide, herbicide, seeds, corn and yams seedlings, and she will hire human labor. She is very optimistic that the business will succeed because she has a good business site and the population is increasing every day; as such the demand for food is also increasing. The community will buy at a cheaper rate and she will also employ human labor.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, fungicide, herbicide, seeds, corn and yams seedlings, and to hire human labor.

loans.name: Brayan De Jesús

texts.es: Brayan en compañía de su cónyuge, laboran diariamente en su restaurante de Sopas y Sancochos típicos de la región Caribe, negocio que heredó de su suegra tras su fallecimiento. Todos los días sus clientes pueden visitarlos en su local ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla y degustar de sus platos que son servidos a lo tradicional en totumas un emblema de la Costa Caribe Colombiana. La carta del restaurant es bastante variada, todos los días de la semana hay un sancocho diferente; mondongo, costilla, gallinas, guandules, zaragoza, trifásico, pescado y demás. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar víveres al por mayor y obtener descuentos por comprar en volúmenes.  Su meta a futuro es remodelar el local para ofrecer más comodidad a los comensales y comprar la vivienda donde funciona el negocio.
texts.en:
Brayan and his wife work every day in their restaurant, a business he inherited from his mother-in-law after she died. They make traditional Caribbean soups and stews. Their customers can visit them every day in their eatery located in the town of Barranquilla and savor their dishes served traditionally in gourds, a symbol of the Caribbean coast of Colombia. The menu is quite varied. Every day of the week there's a different soup: sausage, ribs, chicken, pigeon pea, "Zaragoza" [red beans], "trifásico" [beef, poultry, and pork], fish, and others.

Brayan is currently applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy provisions wholesale and get a discount for buying in bulk.

His goal for the future is to remodel his space so he can offer his diners greater comfort. He also wants to buy the house where he runs the business.

loans.use: to buy provisions wholesale

loans.name: Anacelia

texts.pt: A senhora Anacélia é solteira e vive sozinha. É Assistente administrativa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar mercadorias tais como tissagem(cabelo) para revender. Tem sonho de desenvolver no seu negócio e construir a sua própria casa, comprar uma viatura e casar-se.Tem como maior desafio fazer o ensino superior e trabalhar cada vez mais.
texts.en:
Anacélia is single and lives alone. She works as an administrative assistant and she will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise such as hair extensions that she can resell.

Her plans for the future are to grow her business, build her own house, buy a vehicle and get married. She would like to challenge herself to go to college and to work harder.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions for resale.
